commit_message:
check task_state in the live_migrate_instance

If server migration fails, the while loop will not break
until retry to 0,
we can check the task_state to avoid this situation.

Closes-Bug: #1728476
Change-Id: I07e1048eb736263a261456ee78c96fee9db13cb5

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information

commit_message:
fix radosgw meter name

meter name in entrypoint should match actual meter name so it can
probably be enabled/filtered in polling/pipeline

Change-Id: I8ffbfc5ff65c505734ccc6c5fd4270ecf46d16e8
Closes-Bug: #1726458

commit_message:
Fix workflow update

Updating a workflow resource was broken because of some unexpected
conditions filtering input, params and description. This removes those
conditions and update the workflow regularly.

Change-Id: I3bd187f8012bf4bddae1010fcf4a028c1829c644
(cherry picked from commit 721965f2ec7af7b584f13454cd5a41d68490dd47)

commit_message:
Update helm-toolkit sync mechanism across repos

This patch set adds in the mechanism to use zuul-cloner in the zuul-gate
to pull in openstack-helm's helm-toolkit.  This allows for CRD to work
as expected and the code can be centralized in the OS-H instead of three
repos: OS-H, OS-H-infra, and OS-H-addons.

Change-Id: Ia5558491b80413e86ce6f133aa50c565a1dc0374

subject: Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 16:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session

With the introduction of OVO objects, most l2pop methods were updated to
use a context, and not a session:
Idf72866d36f27ad0aa9b7a0b53034d2db45cd56d

The OVS driver calls 2 of these methods, so update the related code to
pass the context along

Change-Id: I394f8a16a19bcd16d65a9fcfb985d6fb6217d093
Closes-Bug: #1730076
'}]
commit_message:
Update l2pop calls to use context instead of session

With the introduction of OVO objects, most l2pop methods were updated to
use a context, and not a session:
Idf72866d36f27ad0aa9b7a0b53034d2db45cd56d

The OVS driver calls 2 of these methods, so update the related code to
pass the context along

Change-Id: I394f8a16a19bcd16d65a9fcfb985d6fb6217d093
Closes-Bug: #1730076

commit_message:
Update OpenStack Client syntax for graphs (doc)

The OSC syntax for specifying branching points in Service Graphs
is going to be different than initially designed. Instead of:

--port-chains pc1:pc2,pc3;pc2:pc4,pc5

Now it will look like:

--branching-point pc1:pc2,pc3 --branching-point pc2:pc4,pc5

Change-Id: Idcfdc0eacf373ed3961079edfdca948495c2ea1e
Partial-Bug: #1587486

commit_message:
Add retries to read-only db operations

To prevent possible failures because of operational errors
we should add retries and send additional requests to the
database.

This change will increase the overall stability of the system
and will avoid obscure errors from the database.

Change-Id: I9ddef565acabbbfaddcb96f6a850a21875e6dcd5
Closes-bug: #1730426

commit_message:
Fix typo in config options

Some drivers:transport:websocket options had dashes instead of
underscore which caused zaqar to ignore them.

Change-Id: I0a0d0ddf5704415745868d39d763df0e43a21a61
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Hervé <therve@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1727406
Closes-Bug: #1730179
(cherry picked from commit f68f5e92179c1f49726dca98796307ad3c8bb4fb)

commit_message:
Support no_auth mode in mistral client

Now it is impossible to send requests without authentication.
This patch allows to disable it if user doesn't provide auth_url
to the client.

Change-Id: I3b964e349dd6843ceb022264abe451a1b407786b
Closes-bug: #1730067
(cherry picked from commit aa65b57816bd29e31355b8cecc9b20d10b0aa307)

commit_message:
Fixes InternalApi Heat network resource

Detection for using legacy network is now in tripleo-common so there is
no need to set it network_data.yaml anymore.

Depends-On: I695259ad87e2303f948875078bccb619786470e0

Closes-Bug: 1718764

Change-Id: I52468a687ba7215ec32c5700de346b3ed4ebd1f9
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix missing neutron net plugin options

They are missing from the sample config produced by
oslo-config-generator due to omissions in manila/opts.py.

Add them.

Closes-Bug: #1728463

Change-Id: Ibc473af77fde48e3a5e761e0b959d145acd7fbf9

commit_message:
Pass base service client config to get_credentials

The get_credentials helper in credentials_factory wraps
around auth.get_credentials but it fails to pass
the http_timeout. Fixing this by replacing the local dict
of configuration settings with config.get_service_config.

Change-Id: I3d6b54818f53c995c5d8359502bf9b8a80e797a1
Closes-bug: #1692484

DNM Set concurrency to 3

Playing with concurrency to see impact on duration and system load.

[{'created': '2017-07-17 14:27:27.000000000', 'message': 'Only set clients when service/api is available

The clients.py module initialises and set attributes for all clients
available in Tempest, regardless of whether the corresponding service
/ api version is configured as available.

This cleanup helps ensuring that tests use the expected version of
services, and prepares client.py to become a stable interface for
plugins.

The clients.py module initialises and set attributes for all clients
available in Tempest, regardless of whether the corresponding service
/ api version is configured as available.

This cleanup helps ensuring that tests use the expected version of
services, and prepares client.py to become a stable interface for

A few bits of code rely on clients being available, regardless of
configuration, which is wrong. Those issues are exposed by this
patch, and fixed here:

commit_message:
Only set clients when service/api is available

The clients.py module initialises and set attributes for all clients
available in Tempest, regardless of whether the corresponding service
/ api version is configured as available.

This cleanup helps ensuring that tests use the expected version of
services, and prepares client.py to become a stable interface for
plugins.

A few bits of code rely on client aliases being defined, regardless of
configuration. Those issues are exposed by this patch, and fixed here.

Services that have multiple major versions are keystone, cinder and
glance. For keystone the API version is controlled via configuration,
already before this patch. Cinder has a _latest client setup in the
clients module and that concept is completed in this patch.
Glance is handled in the base class of relevant tests.

Depends-on: I21f07f7b3e8f22055e7978c0bf4aa01b80b493d9
Change-Id: I8410297f7e80871e74aa64e6907ebbb9e0bba79f

subject: Migrate object storage group to the new manager

commit_message:
Migrate object storage group to the new manager

Migrate the service clients in the object storage group to the
new client manager.

Change-Id: I52187f3979c822bf22007aea619542378f591f96
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-08 22:10:12.000000000', 'message': "Split creds and resources in tenant isolation

WIP - do not merge

In resource-cleanup we split the class setup in several
steps, but in tenant isolation setup of network resources
is triggered automatically so it cannot be separated as-is.
Splitting the setup of credentials and of resources, so
that they can be executed in setup_credentials and
setup_resources respectively.

Expose the resource related methods at cred_provider
level as well, and provide a dummy implementation for now
on the preprovisioned accounts side. A full implementation
will be done here as part of the test-accounts-cont'ed bp.

Required network resources must still be declared at init
time, only they will actually be created later on, at
resource creation time. The reason for this is that in case
of preprovisioned accounts, we must know from the start
which resources are required, as resources will be
pre-provisioned as well.

Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

Change-Id: I369d61c80207d883d00e8e398949ba6bda59b259

commit_message:
Split creds and resources in tenant isolation

In resource-cleanup we split the class setup in several
steps, but in tenant isolation setup of network resources
is triggered automatically so it cannot be separated as-is.
Splitting the setup of credentials and of resources, so
that they can be executed in setup_credentials and
setup_resources respectively.

Expose the resource related methods at cred_provider
level as well, and provide a dummy implementation for now
on the preprovisioned accounts side. A full implementation
will be done here as part of the test-accounts-cont'ed bp.

Required network resources must still be declared at init
time, only they will actually be created later on, at
resource creation time. The reason for this is that in case
of preprovisioned accounts, we must know from the start
which resources are required, as resources will be
pre-provisioned as well.

Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

Change-Id: I369d61c80207d883d00e8e398949ba6bda59b259

commit_message:
Increase code coverage

Covers v2/shell.py:do_share_replica_delete().

This change removes unused branching and extends coverage by testing
raising errors when all replicas deletion failed.

The argument --force can never be None due to action 'store_true'.

Change-Id: I6eeb39921fe032688c172a0666f089ab12afe4c1
Partial-Bug: #1364800

commit_message:
Do not run baremetal scenarios after Ocata

Pike is the release where we support containerized services, we don't
want to run baremetal scenarios anymore, so we save Infra resources.

We still have a few jobs running on baremetal, and they'll be cleanup
later but this iteration is just for the scenarios.

scenario001: only newton/ocata
scenario002: only newton/ocata
scenario003: only ocata
scenario004: only ocata
scenario007: remove it (we have container job in pike/master)

Change-Id: I8587dfde9fe5772444ef942bf278c822e3c7b8f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 03:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Correct policy action for attach/detach volume actions

This PS corrects the policy action for attach and detach
volume actions. There are a few policy actions that currently
have the wrong name. This PS is a pre-requsite for removing
strict_policy_enforce Patrole configuration option in order
to avoid false positives (e.g. a non-existent policy action
being validated against an API).

The os-attach volume actions actually enforces
"volume_extension:volume_actions:attach" and os-detach
actually enforces "volume_extension:volume_actions:detach" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/ae7355c1f8d5d137bfb8bdf7b521ff5519cc20f8/cinder/policies/volume_actions.py#L224

Change-Id: I7d0c99ffb197832182e8f7b2af952f94acd29b0d
'}]
commit_message:
Correct policy action for attach/detach volume actions

This PS corrects the policy action for attach and detach
volume actions. There are a few policy actions that currently
have the wrong name. This PS is a pre-requsite for removing
strict_policy_enforce Patrole configuration option in order
to avoid false positives (e.g. a non-existent policy action
being validated against an API).

The os-attach volume actions actually enforces
"volume_extension:volume_actions:attach" and os-detach
actually enforces "volume_extension:volume_actions:detach" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/ae7355c1f8d5d137bfb8bdf7b521ff5519cc20f8/cinder/policies/volume_actions.py#L224

Change-Id: I7d0c99ffb197832182e8f7b2af952f94acd29b0d

commit_message:
Correct policy action for reserve/unreserve volume actions

This PS corrects the policy action for reserve and unreserve
volume actions. There are a few policy actions that currently
have the wrong name. This PS is a pre-requsite for removing
strict_policy_enforce Patrole configuration option in order
to avoid false positives (e.g. a non-existent policy action
being validated against an API).

The os-reserve volume actions actually enforces
"volume_extension:volume_actions:reserve" and os-unreserve
actually enforces "volume_extension:volume_actions:reserve" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/ae7355c1f8d5d137bfb8bdf7b521ff5519cc20f8/cinder/policies/volume_actions.py#L197

Change-Id: Ib1b68cbde992b57619e877e0a4fe2f1948fdd6c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-31 17:47:23.000000000', 'message': 'Test shared and non-shared floating networks

floating network is the external network which floating ips are
allocated on.

The test_list_floating_ips_from_admin_and_nonadmin test verifies
the visibility of floating ips. The current implementation works
correctly for a non-shared, floating network.

For a shared network the test incorrectly fails. This change
verifies the floating ip visibility as follows:
 * if the floating network is shared, the floating ips are visible
 * if the floating network is not shared, the floating ips  are
   not visible

Change-Id: I8a341635eec2fdd4a285f0d8060dbacf443d6b4e
Closes-Bug: #1729047
'}]
commit_message:
Test shared and non-shared floating networks

floating network is the external network which floating ips are
allocated on.

The test_list_floating_ips_from_admin_and_nonadmin test verifies
the visibility of floating ips. The current implementation works
correctly for a non-shared, floating network.

For a shared network the test incorrectly fails. This change
verifies the floating ip visibility as follows:
 * if the floating network is shared, the floating ips are visible
 * if the floating network is not shared, the floating ips  are
   not visible

Change-Id: I8a341635eec2fdd4a285f0d8060dbacf443d6b4e
Closes-Bug: #1729047

commit_message:
test_network_v6: log instance addresses on failure

If a test case failed to wait before an IP address was configured for an
instance, it may be helpful to log what is actually in the 'ip address'
output to help debugging test failures.

Change-Id: I979420661a980fea148df1731771147d531a5ecb

commit_message:
Remove legacy connector constants

These constants were moved over a year ago and we have had several releases
since then. The old ones that were kept for backwards compatibility can now
be removed.

Depends-on: I8682804d2299db793c1e4397a07ff67608a8bda6
Change-Id: Ia18de03880ca5b04d31dbdf7891fa6d3240ae9b5

subject: Fix version maps for snaps and debs
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-11-02 09:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17645, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-11-07 21:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM and I double checked that snap/pkg versions do match up correctly.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 09:03:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix version maps for snaps and debs

This ensures that charms don't try to upgrade themselves everytime
an update-status hook call occurs; specifically we need to map the
numerical version to the latest OpenStack release that carries
that version for the UCA.

Gnocchi does always major release with OpenStack.

Change-Id: I777097c5188c73523fc4c41fc698b6dc6a87fd24
"}]
commit_message:
Fix version maps for snaps and debs

This ensures that charms don't try to upgrade themselves everytime
an update-status hook call occurs; specifically we need to map the
numerical version to the latest OpenStack release that carries
that version for the UCA.

Gnocchi does always major release with OpenStack.

Change-Id: I777097c5188c73523fc4c41fc698b6dc6a87fd24

commit_message:
refresh agent if group membership changes

this broke when we switched to tooz partitioner
- ensure we trigger refresh if group changes
- ensure we have heartbeat or else members will just die.

- remove retain_common_targets tests because it doesn't make sense.
it was originally designed for when we had listener per pipeline
but that was changed 726b2d4d67ada3df07f36ecfd81b0cf72881e159
- remove testing workload partitioning path in standard notification
agent tests
- correct test_unique test to properly validate a single target
rather than the number of listeners we have.
- add test to ensure group_state is updated when a member joins
- add test to verify that listener assigned topics based on hashring

Closes-Bug: #1729617
Change-Id: I5039c93e6845a148c24094f755a78870d49ec19f

commit_message:
Revert "devstack: Set an optimal processing queue"

This reverts commit f1bdf6751a503ee570ce114f9a31fdb2959a79d0.

this causes distribution to be either 50/50 or 100/0. in the latter
case, the single worker usually fails to process pipeline queues in a
timely manner

Change-Id: I7c34acb29290de641ccbef4844e1e6982fe8b173

commit_message:
Switch the deprecated "ironic" CLI to "latest" API version by default

The functional tests were updated to account for the initial state changed
to "enroll" and for new fields appearing in "show" and "update" responses.

Closes-Bug: #1671145
Change-Id: Ida18541fbbc8064868cac0accb6919de08e9f795

commit_message:
Allow IPv6 gateways for the default route

Remove assumption that subnets and gateways are always ipv4 in
the NetApp driver.

Partially implements: bp netapp-ontap-ipv6-support

Change-Id: Ia26d55368aa5a08da7e0941170ed2ac23db307d4

commit_message:
Fixes URL path for SFC v2 Driver

Due to this fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496388/,
now URL for OpenDaylight driver is not created correctly.

Correct url has format

http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/portpairs

Now it produces

http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/port-pairs

Closes-Bug: 1724644
Partial-bug: #1713697
Duplicate-patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512951/

Change-Id: Ie4a75323694c69aaa5e682890647beaf461b6888
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>
(cherry picked from commit 7366ac0455a335e8f56a8467515bca33f3d29e28)

subject: Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 9098, 'name': 'Nathan Kinder', 'email': 'nkinder@redhat.com', 'username': 'nkinder'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 17893, 'name': 'Luke Hinds', 'email': 'lhinds@redhat.com', 'username': 'lhinds'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26828, 'name': 'cjeanneret - deactivated', 'email': 'cedric.jeanneret@camptocamp.com', 'username': 'Tengu'}]

[{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 06:52:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I suppose that this is technically an API breaking change, so we'll need to make sure we reflect that in the next version number we use for the context library."}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 07:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I think you're over-thinking this. It's fine to make a breaking change. It's *very* minor in this case. I only made the comment to remind everyone to help make sure the version number is updated appropriately."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

mask password for dict is here: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L316

but it looks like oslo.context doesn't depends on oslo.utils, so we perhaps not be able to use it.

I don't get the use-case behind the hashing thing.

If auth_token goes to the log even it's obscured with a hash, it's still leak.

If the use case behind this method get_logging_values() is only for oslo.log. we must hide the password like all other places in Openstack. e.g: replacing auth_token by ******.

With "None", deployer/user/debugger will not understand why sometimes it's null and sometimes it's '******'. Personally, if I see 'None' in logging message I will conclude that the auth_token is unset, while it's not.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Mehdi, you make a good point about using "***" instead of Null. I can use that then.

Regarding the hash; I disagree that hashing it "leaks it", as it's a one-way function. So it can't can be used to steal a bearer token.

On the other hand, what this does provide is, in the case of a suspected malicious activity, from the logs we could check what token was used, or at least uniquely identify it with the hash, and check which requests are being done with that token. It might even be that the malicious actor impersonates a different user, so it would make that case easier to catch.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 17893, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:44:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

lgtm, I don't see any risks of leakage as it is a one way hash as jaosorior points out. Having an actual track able ID is helpful for when an operator needs to audit as system and could help spot abuse. 

One note, you will need a # nosec comment as Bandit will flag up sha1 for being insecure."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:45:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Good call on the # nosec Luke, I'll add that. Would be good to have bandit test this codebase too :D.

The reason I used sha1 was because I didn't want this have too much performance penalty."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 17893, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:52:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

The token isn't an identifier for the user. There is a separate request ID that can be used to track individual requests. We even have request ID chaining now so you can track the request across several services. Just remove the token from the return value for the function like in your first version of the patch. We don't need all of the hash stuff."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

tracking is already done with request-id stuffs...'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:56:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Doug, Mehdi: as far as I've understood, you can use the same token for different requests, and it'll be valid, and it will also have different request-id's"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 11:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 11:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 11:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> tracking is already done with request-id stuffs...

yes, but nope. The specific usecase is more security-oriented, in order to ensure a specific token isn't wrongly used. That's why having its hash is important - it allows to ensure that specific token is OK, or we must kill it.

~> the auth_token tracking isn't the same purpose as request tracking.

Regarding the "hashed stuff is also leak", true, but in the current context, it's still far, far better than clear text as it's currently the case.
For the records, unless set differently, logs are local to the nodes, thus accessed by users with "some" powers - therefore, it's not the auth_id that will be important for them in case of take over (meaning: clear-text might be OK. I emphase the *might*).

In my case at work, we send all the logs to a central ELK through rsyslog. The access to Kibana are more or less secured, but we're not that sure all is sealed in order to prevent log leaks (think transport, storage, and so on). Having the *hashed* auth_token is a (yet small) security measure that allows us to:
- still be able to ensure token aren't misused (we can follow them)
- still be able to say "nope, they aren't in cleartext" in case of kibana, storage or anything in-between the openstack node and end-user is compromised at some level.

Seeing how it goes, I therefore propose the following:
- by default, call mask_password in the get_logging function
- allow users to enable hashed token with a simple configuration

That should comply with all the needs:
- security by default without any hint of the token content
- ability for people to activate a way to follow token directly'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 12:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

Fine for me, this one in the current state is necessary for the sake of security.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-07 13:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9311, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Is this precautionary or has the leak been observed in oslo.context user?'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:20:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Tristan, it's precautionary. I want to enable the JSON formatter. And it currently doesn't output the context (even though it should but that's a different bug). So, before actually enabling that formatter to output the context [1], I want to fix this first so we don't have any vulnerable point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517894/"}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2017-11-07 15:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-11-07 18:25:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

lgtm.  It sounds like the hashing functionality may require more discussion, so I think doing this as an initial step is good.

I think Doug's comments have been addressed, but I'm going to let him pull the trigger on this one just to be safe."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 06:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't output auth_token for logging

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs. Lets filter it out from that function instead.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}, {'created': '2017-11-07 06:36:52.000000000', 'message': "Don't output auth_token for logging

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}, {'created': '2017-11-07 10:51:32.000000000', 'message': "Ouput a null value or a hash instead of the auth_token

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as a null value by
default, however, it's possible to still get a token identifier, since
it adds the option to get a hash of the token instead.

The aforementioned option to get a hashed auth_token is useful in
auditing cases, and in attempting to spot malicious activity, as it
singles out a token that's used and allows for filtering based on that.
This way, even if a malicious actor manages to take over a token and
impersonate another user (by overwritting X-User-Id or similar fields)
we will still be able to spot that the same token was used.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}, {'created': '2017-11-07 11:05:34.000000000', 'message': "Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token

get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as '***' by
default.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}, {'created': '2017-11-07 11:08:18.000000000', 'message': "Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token

get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as '***' by
default.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
"}]
commit_message:
Ouput a placeholder instead of the auth_token

As the name of the get_logging_values suggests, that function will
get entries from the context for logging purposes. For this, we
shouldn't need the auth_token since it might potentially leak
in the logs.

This filters out the auth_token by setting it as '***' by
default.

Change-Id: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5

[{'account_id': 24184, 'date': '2017-11-06 12:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-06 12:33:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2017-11-06 13:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

since is the addition of a new parameter you should add a release note and tests for the new parameter. If you have any doubts you can ping us on IRC #puppet-openstack'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-06 13:31:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The change looks good except please cover with a test.

You'll just need to update this part:
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/blob/master/spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb#L137

Docs around testing are located here:
https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/testing.html"}, {'account_id': 24184, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Adds Neutron parameter max_allowed_address_pair

Adds a new Puppet parameter "max_allowed_address_pair" which goes into
the neutron.conf configuration file and allows to change that parameter
to any number (default is 10).

Change-Id: Id187696a28c9e721aa4a62a2208e9c8b8397f1ed
Closes-Bug: 1730367

commit_message:
Add dnsmasq_local_resolv option

Add 'dnsmasq_local_resolv' option support to Enables the dnsmasq
service to provide name resolution for instances via DNS resolvers
on the host running the DHCP agent.

Change-Id: I451777a573fd31dd5d6732303956f17bb67c22e0
Closes-Bug: #1728795

commit_message:
Add ability of managing ssh key generation

This patch add the ability to generate ssh key pair for Amphora
instances to use, it will be disabled by default.

Depends-On: I641c3a380c5647d28535914e3a6fb5dd793b6fba

Change-Id: I0e7c7df629600f027220272613fc0c85c9d27d76

commit_message:
Fix ocata gate issues

This includes two changes:

1. set CEILOMETER_BACKEND=mysql for pike/ocata
2. Switch integration jobs to use local mirrors

The Fedora 24 image mirror used does not exist anymore.
Let's use Fedora 26 and the nodepool morrors.

Change-Id: I42490c82a37a179414b5d34f547df4d145ee8aa7
Closes-Bug: #1728883
(cherry picked from commit 7d0ce4a1be11a28d60cd40342afe6a6aa2b66d1c
and a47e342f4d0cad4ff314a3f546b6661c8ec67777)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-04 15:31:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use infra publish jobs

The legacy job does the same as the infra publish job, so use that one
directly via the publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra template.

For openstack-zuul-jobs, use publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra instead
of individual jobs.

Needed-By: I253cf2d5aef8a731d2632d4b683f80d21083c93a
Change-Id: I99082384c638a159e2600bd8da97b86e93c77c2a
'}]
commit_message:
Use infra publish jobs

The legacy job does the same as the infra publish job, so use that one
directly via the publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra template.

For openstack-zuul-jobs, use publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-infra instead
of individual jobs.

Needed-By: I253cf2d5aef8a731d2632d4b683f80d21083c93a
Change-Id: I99082384c638a159e2600bd8da97b86e93c77c2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-29 09:51:12.000000000', 'message': "Unify undercloud upgrade steps

The steps needed to upgrade the undercloud were
specified in two different files. This commit
updates the steps to cover O to P from commit
496223 in the 'Undercloud Installation' section
and reuses that doc file for the 'Upgrading to
a Next Major Release'.

As an addition, a new class 'otop' has been
added to include specific documentation sections
when upgrading from Ocata to Pike.

Change-Id: I9097ca11a95f94c5eaf580fb8a82b3173d606a5d

commit_message:
Unify undercloud upgrade steps

The steps needed to upgrade the undercloud were
specified in two different files. This commit
updates the steps to cover O to P from commit
496223 in the 'Undercloud Installation' section
and reuses that doc file for the 'Upgrading to
a Next Major Release'.

As an addition, a new class 'otop' has been
added to include specific documentation sections
when upgrading from Ocata to Pike.

Change-Id: I9097ca11a95f94c5eaf580fb8a82b3173d606a5d

[{'created': '2017-10-24 18:45:13.000000000', 'message': "Fixes a var dependency between Neutron and Octavia

If Octavia's V1 API is activated (aka Octavia is not running
stand alone) Neutron needs to reach the Octavia API and is
using the variable to set up the URL in neutron.conf. Without this
configuring Neutron with Octavia support will fail.

Change-Id: I6dacbfc3dd9d6911b6707d067cf6e1aab64e0126
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes a var dependency between Neutron and Octavia

If Octavia's V1 API is activated (aka Octavia is not running
stand alone) Neutron needs to reach the Octavia API and is
using the variable to set up the URL in neutron.conf. Without this
configuring Neutron with Octavia support will fail.

Change-Id: I6dacbfc3dd9d6911b6707d067cf6e1aab64e0126

commit_message:
Option to configure virtual_route through keepalived

Keepalived offers option to add virtual_route for individual
virtual_interfaces. These rules moves across nodes with change in
virtual_interfaces for MASTER, to BACKUP node.
The current keepalived.conf template does not provide any option
to configure virtual_route. This patch adds option to enable the
feature.
Closes-bug: #1455175

Change-Id: Ie8111fa6017378d00e2331faabb98c83d83d301f

commit_message:
Glance registry_host should use glance.registry.host

Glance-api should talk to the registry using
glance.registry.host (the vip) rather than using
the localhost address.

Change-Id: I67d2808ed8da8f4ec8cc1140973a8363e80636bb

commit_message:
Fix resources for latest puppet

The unit tests for puppet 5 (running via latest) is failing on some
modules because the catalog created in the test doesn't contain the
resources being referenced in requires/subscribes.

Change-Id: I927d517d68bf23aea3837e985afdc8443c2b98c9
Closes-Bug: #1729212

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-24 15:18:06.000000000', 'message': "Require lock_path limit to be a positive int

Currently if limit=0 is passed to lock_path then the method will time
out and never acquire a lock which is reasonable but not useful. This
is a potential pitfall given that in other contexts, for example
diskfile's replication_lock, a concurrency value of 0 has the meaning
'no limit'. It would be easy to erroneously assume that the same
semantic holds for lock_path.

To avoid that pitfall, this patch makes it an error to pass limit<1 to
lock_path.

Related-Change: I3c3193344c7a57a8a4fc7932d1b10e702efd3572
Change-Id: I9ea7ee5b93e3d6924bff9790141b107b53f77883
"}]
commit_message:
Require lock_path limit to be a positive int

Currently if limit=0 is passed to lock_path then the method will time
out and never acquire a lock which is reasonable but not useful. This
is a potential pitfall given that in other contexts, for example
diskfile's replication_lock, a concurrency value of 0 has the meaning
'no limit'. It would be easy to erroneously assume that the same
semantic holds for lock_path.

To avoid that pitfall, this patch makes it an error to pass limit<1 to
lock_path.

Related-Change: I3c3193344c7a57a8a4fc7932d1b10e702efd3572
Change-Id: I9ea7ee5b93e3d6924bff9790141b107b53f77883

'}, {'created': '2017-11-07 10:13:47.000000000', 'message': 'Implement policy in code (1)

This commit will prepare for implementing policies in code[1]
that mean with oslo.policy, we can define all of default rules
in code base and only update some rules via policy file if need.
We also should use yaml format instead of json format from now
as a recommandation from Oslo team.

To do that, we can move "rule by rule" into code base.
In this change, we will:

- Define some common rules in code base.
- Register them into policy engine to use as default policy rules
- Remove them out of policy.json file, so if operators want to
update rules, they should define them in policy file like the way
we done with config option with oslo.config.
- And also similar with oslo.config, we will support generating sample
policy file (YAML fomart) for now.

Summary, with any rules that we defined in codebase, we no need to keep
them in policy file anymore if we don't want to customize them.
And everything still work well meanwhile we didn't define rules
in policy file with falling back to default rules.


[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: Ide8f581b9adb6701eeb9b1f5293307dcee3dd9c3
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-11-07 11:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'Implement policy in code (1)

commit_message:
Implement policy in code (1)

This commit will prepare for implementing policies in code[1]
that mean with oslo.policy, we can define all of default rules
in code base and only update some rules via policy file if need.

To do that, we can move "rule by rule" into code base.
In this change, we will:

- Define some common rules in code base.
- Register them into policy engine to use as default policy rules
- Remove them out of policy.json file, so if operators want to
update rules, they should define them in policy file like the way
we done with config option with oslo.config.

Summary, with any rules that we defined in codebase, we no need to keep
them in policy file anymore if we don't want to customize them.
And everything still work well meanwhile we didn't define rules
in policy file with falling back to default rules.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: Ide8f581b9adb6701eeb9b1f5293307dcee3dd9c3
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>

and omitting the extension is now deprecated. Update references
to include the extension.

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I19247a0e3bd97c1199dfdc7070717bbe8e3d0314

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I19247a0e3bd97c1199dfdc7070717bbe8e3d0314

commit_message:
Ignore rally nitrogen job for ocata branch

It does not apply and it fails innecesarely. This patch adds ocata to
the ignore list.

Change-Id: I942402cbc6ac5e493dfdf2d2fb83859163d1e506

subject: Move to a common lock-file directory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3211, 'name': 'zhangjialong', 'email': 'zhangjl@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhangjl'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-22 16:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3211, 'date': '2017-10-24 01:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-24 05:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-24 07:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do you have old and failing logs or a test case for the referenced patch?

IMHO the problem was not that the lock file remains, but that both the patched version and the patch itself are buggy: there is no way to remove the lock file.

I can imagine that the problem occurred *because* the lock file was removed: this leads to situations where the critical section was entered multiple times at the same time by different instances.

You can check the small script [1]: start it twice and in another shell remove the LOCK_FILE a couple of times; doing so leads to the situation where the critical section is executed twice at the same time.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/624425/'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> but that both the patched version and the patch itself are buggy: there is no way to remove the lock file.

The lockfile is supposed to be persistent.  After looking again, you're right that we shouldn't remove the file here ... it's reversing the .rpmmacros changes that are important in that section.

We scatter a few of these lockfiles around and it's a bit confusing.  I think it makes more sense to put them in a common location, i think ~/.cache/dib/lockfiles is as good as any.  this proposes that along with the removal"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-25 06:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm fine with the locking directory.

Nevertheless: renaming the cache directory for DIB means to leave behind meaga/gigabytes of never again used data:

$ du -sh ~/.cache/image-create/
2.7G	/home/dib/.cache/image-create/

A possible solution would be to add a line like

    rm -fr /home/dib/.cache/image-create/

to disk-image-create - at least until the next major release and also document this in the release notes. (Or / and file a separate patch for this...)"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-26 05:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

fair point, let's just namespace things in ~/.config/dib from now on"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-26 05:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2017-10-27 10:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Shall we give some special perms to that directory, or are we safe with default perms?'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-11-02 07:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

@Yolanda: IMHO default permissions are ok.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck

zuul timeout'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2017-11-07 15:47:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-22 16:27:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove deletion of lock file for yum / rpm

Currently the lock file is removed inside the critical section, like:

    while true; do
        ( flock -w 1200 9 || exit 1
          echo "Inside locked section"
          sleep $1
          rm LOCK_FILE
          echo "After removing file"
          sleep $2
        ) 9>LOCK_FILE
    done

As a result not the complete critical section is executed inside
the lock and depending on the timing the removal of the lock file
failes with:

    + /tmp/dib_build.oVODMTfY/hooks/root.d/08-yum-chroot:_install_pkg_manager:205      :   rm /home/dib/.rpmmacros.dib.lock
    rm: cannot remove '/home/dib/.rpmmacros.dib.lock': No such file or directory

This patch removes the removal of the lock file - which results in a
correct handling but also leaves a one file with zero length 'resource
leak'.  There is no way to sensible clean up this lock file.

There is no test case included in this patch because the current
testing setup (mostly one script that runs sequential functional
tests) is not capable of handling parallelism.
There is an implicit test case included in the docker matrix build [1]
patch, because there the images are created in parallel and from
time to time the unpatched version stops with the referenced
error.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414347/

Change-Id: Ie810b2836be521325afe923708d046112e1e1e20
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'created': '2017-10-25 03:49:05.000000000', 'message': "Move to a common lock-file directory

In a couple of places we use flock for critical sections, but we leave
lockfiles around in various locations which can be confusing.

Introduce DIB_LOCKFILES global (under ~/.cache/dib/lockfiles) and
write lockfiles in there.

For consistency, move the image cache under ~/.cache/dib too.

Fix up removal of the lockfile in the yum path; we just want to make
sure we cleanup the .rpmmacros file, but we don't need to remove the
lockfile as well.

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

Change-Id: Ie810b2836be521325afe923708d046112e1e1e20

Introduce DIB_LOCKFILES global (under ~/.cache/dib/lockfiles) and

Fix up removal of the lockfile in the yum path; we just want to make

commit_message:
Move to a common lock-file directory

In a couple of places we use flock for critical sections, but we leave
lockfiles around in various locations which can be confusing.

Introduce DIB_LOCKFILES global (under ~/.cache/dib/lockfiles) and
write lockfiles in there.

Fix up removal of the lockfile in the yum path; we just want to make
sure we cleanup the .rpmmacros file, but we don't need to remove the
lockfile as well.

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

Change-Id: Ie810b2836be521325afe923708d046112e1e1e20

commit_message:
Add test for flavor

We increased in three patch for flavor-list disk, vcpu, ephemeral,
but did not have a corresponding test to test whether can obtain.
we once have a test by trove/api-ref/source/samples/db-flavors-response.json,
but is not have now, even if I had deleted the file, the test still
can get through it.

Change-Id: Ibe93c975d93158407fefaeeb2e7a48325d03d5b7

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I7db56d052012b107e1e63ab81e5d3bf6090f7d2f

commit_message:
Add ability to provide configdrive when rebuilding with OSC

Ironic introduces the API microversion 1.35 which allows
configdrive to be provided when setting the node's provisioning state
to "rebuild".

This change adds the ability to provide a config-drive
when rebuilding a node.

Closes-bug: #1575935
Change-Id: I950ac35bcde97b0f93225f80f989d42c5519faf2

commit_message:
use command line arguments in the main method

Command line arguments are not passed to main method but later
on if args are none then command line arguments are used.

Commands line arguments should be accessed at one point and
forward, where ever is required. But current script uses command
line argument in between the processing, which reduces readability.

Change-Id: Id9df9bd3c18e9ae8fc601b54d53f0c1984841013

commit_message:
Make Doc links point to the latest branch

Several links haven't been updated when doc migration in Pike. So
let them point to the latest branch instead of Ocata.

Change-Id: Ie93acdd7e4ccabd412e2c0324da2dce04fcdf569
Partial-Bug: #1727460

commit_message:
Migrating legacy jobs

Moving legacy jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs to manila
repository. In order for us to start reworking the legacy
jobs to native v3 jobs, we need to do so.
This is the first step as described in the manual
and will also make it easier to remove the in-tree
tempest plugin sooner.

Depends-On: Ib83267ef75f91fb8f95af312d644ebe19c6307c9
Depends-On: Ia9226329035508c37ca499e6efbd2382502eb141
Change-Id: I7c9fbbb22860a2d246a9e6cb834f7c87875344f0
(cherry picked from commit 6fec3f23566a6952215ef1e7250a9ea9ecd57f93)

commit_message:
Ensure that we resolve AAAA if prefer-ipv6 is True

We currently resolve A records regardless of whether
prefer-ipv6 is True or False. This patch ensures
that we request AAAA in the case where prefer-ipv6
is True.

Change-Id: I0749cd01e504fb4010addcd91bda3a1f32a03fab
Closes-Bug: 1729572

[{'created': '2017-11-06 12:06:15.000000000', 'message': 'Only use PciPassthroughFilter when sriov enabled

Fixes code that inadvertently interprets strings as
booleans resulting in them always being True.
PciPassthroughFilter will now only be added to
scheduler_default_filters if sriov is enabled.

Change-Id: Ie2c79e98d7880e8172ac7e77febb51af04732bec
Closes-Bug: 1730369
'}]
commit_message:
Only use PciPassthroughFilter when sriov enabled

Fixes code that inadvertently interprets strings as
booleans resulting in them always being True.
PciPassthroughFilter will now only be added to
scheduler_default_filters if sriov is enabled.

Change-Id: Ie2c79e98d7880e8172ac7e77febb51af04732bec
Closes-Bug: 1730369

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 17:11:59.000000000', 'message': 'compute: fix libvirt discovery for domains that are not managed by Nova

If a domain is not managed by Nova, the metadata are not present in the XML
file, therefore domain.metadata() explodes and raises a libvirtError.

This catches the exception and ignores the VMs.

Change-Id: Ifb14f823efcacc71c8115201363768547e77c947
'}]
commit_message:
compute: fix libvirt discovery for domains that are not managed by Nova

If a domain is not managed by Nova, the metadata are not present in the XML
file, therefore domain.metadata() explodes and raises a libvirtError.

This catches the exception and ignores the VMs.

Change-Id: Ifb14f823efcacc71c8115201363768547e77c947

commit_message:
project.yaml: Remove 'branches:' & jobs that don't run on master

Remove jobs which are not running on master based on their 'branches:'
specification.

Remove the 'branches:' specification on all jobs.

Also remove the jobs from zuul.d/legacy-ironic-jobs.yaml and
corresponding files in playbooks/legacy/

Change-Id: I8e068fa30feb98c32a8caa6b106a02cf3280b195

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-13 12:54:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect rating for network.floating

The volume of floating.ip pushed by ceilometer (whatever backend
used) is the numerical status of the floating, leading to an
incorrect rating by CK.

With ceilometer collector, the value is already forced to 1 (as

commit_message:
Fix incorrect rating for network.floating

The volume of floating.ip pushed by ceilometer (whatever backend
used) is the numerical status of the floating, leading to an
incorrect rating by CK.

With ceilometer collector, the value is already forced to 1 (as
for compute). This patch fixes the bug for the gnocchi collector.

An upper constraint has been set on oslo.config to match the ocata release.
(Some function prototypes have been modified,
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503181/)

Change-Id: I974db35a87c3a791f25e19dbbeac77a4fae0a25f
Closes-Bug: #1659491
Closes-Bug: #1722847

[{'created': '2017-10-12 08:48:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix permissions for dockerized horizon

Horizon needs write access to its log file and read permissions for all
of its configuration files.

The code that was supposed to set the permissions did it in the wrong
directory.

Closes-Bug: #1719590
Co-Authored-By: Martin Andre <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0c125fac38cd186f98b9bc69bcc570f669eb6de1
(cherry picked from commit 960d7ff1025a568343aa5ae5ef95386306de8cab)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions for dockerized horizon

Horizon needs write access to its log file and read permissions for all
of its configuration files.

The code that was supposed to set the permissions did it in the wrong
directory.

Closes-Bug: #1719590
Co-Authored-By: Martin Andre <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0c125fac38cd186f98b9bc69bcc570f669eb6de1
(cherry picked from commit 960d7ff1025a568343aa5ae5ef95386306de8cab)

commit_message:
Use normal socket file permissions instead of polkit

The default (on RHEL/CentOS) is to use polkit but this is only useful
for GUI support or for fine grained API access control.  As we don't
require either we can achieve identical control using plain old unix
filesystem permissions.

Change-Id: I1d5072e3b0b6e825aee1d2cd12b74c9037953ad0
Depends-On: If6c81d0e39a3769096770a1fffe39e6694ae9355

commit_message:
Updating imports for ml2 config options

networking-odl imports neutron/plugins/ml2/config.This file
is being refactored and moved to neutron/conf/plugins/ml2.
This patchset updates import statements.

Change-Id: Id0a97dda7718f06e33b2d30ce01cdcb3e9a46f7d
Depends-On: Ibc5a9ab268578c243ef13f7e0041bacd6c0c410b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 15:02:34.000000000', 'message': 'Call the proper playbook for puppet-syntax-3-centos-7

The puppet-syntax-3-centos-7 job is trying to call the
legacy/puppet-syntax-3-centos-7/run.yaml playbook, which does not exist.
Probably some conversion error during the zuul v3 migration.

The correct one is probably legacy/puppet-syntax-3/run.yaml -- they
differ very little from legacy/puppet-syntax-4-centos-7/run.yaml, only
in the "3" vs "4" versioning.

Change-Id: I8c7dd01ca894beb3554ce3c80045fa4841887080
Closes-Bug: #1730477
'}]
commit_message:
Call the proper playbook for puppet-syntax-3-centos-7

The puppet-syntax-3-centos-7 job is trying to call the
legacy/puppet-syntax-3-centos-7/run.yaml playbook, which does not exist.
Probably some conversion error during the zuul v3 migration.

The correct one is probably legacy/puppet-syntax-3/run.yaml -- they
differ very little from legacy/puppet-syntax-4-centos-7/run.yaml, only
in the "3" vs "4" versioning.

Change-Id: I8c7dd01ca894beb3554ce3c80045fa4841887080
Closes-Bug: #1730477

I'm pretty uncomfortable with the whole notion of having a thread_group_mgr attribute in the Stack object. It looks like we originally started doing this so we could use it to send Zaqar notifications? (This seems like a mistake, as that's something we do not want to cancel when e.g. an update is cancelled.) But now we're also doing it on an ad-hoc basis for convergence operations. At the very least we should set it when creating the Stack object, instead of having 10 different places we have to remember to set it before calling a function that may use it.

This appears to be a correct fix though, so +2."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-09-29 02:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

IMO, this also fixes bug #1698135'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-05 03:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

commit_message:
Set stack.thread_group_mgr for cancel_update

In change I84d2b34d65b3ce7d8d858de106dac531aff509b7, we changed to
call self._converge_create_or_update() in a sub-thread. However,
thread_group_mgr is not set for cancel_update (with rollback),
which in turn calls converge_stack.

This also enables test_cancel_update_server_with_port, as
bug #1607714 seems to be fixed now.

Change-Id: Ie674fd556418f6aa8e79654458cbe43648851db2
Closes-Bug: #1713952

[{'account_id': 18503, 'date': '2017-10-05 18:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-10-05 18:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-05 19:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-05 18:04:24.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - collectd chart to collect metrics

collectd has a wide range of available plugins. Python plugin has been utilized in this chart to
collect openstack api check metrics. Metrics are exposed for a prometheus scrape at port 9103.
Other collection such as hardware(IPMI, SMART, ISCSI etc) collection,
operating system(proc, cpu, processes etc.) can be introduced by configuring plugins available at
https://collectd.org/wiki/index.php/Table_of_Plugins.

example scrape output:

kubectl exec <pod-name> -n monitoring -- curl http://localhost:9103
--------
collectd_check_openstack_api_gauge{check_openstack_api="ceilometer-api",instance="40ad2d53a7dc" 0 1507096547649
collectd_check_openstack_api_gauge{check_openstack_api="nova-api",instance="40ad2d53a7dc" 1 1507096547649
collectd_processes_ps_pagefaults_minflt_total{processes="collectd",instance="ubuntu-xenial" 0 1507221316671
collectd_processes_ps_disk_octets_write_total{processes="collectd",instance="ubuntu-xenial" 62497 1507221316671

Change-Id: Ib70a06dcde1e0743983076645fd82c0fa67d2e2c
'}, {'created': '2017-10-05 19:18:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - collectd chart to collect metrics

collect openstack api check metrics. Metrics are exposed for a prometheus scrape at port 9103.
Other collection such as hardware(IPMI, SMART, ISCSI etc) collection,
operating system(proc, cpu, processes etc.) can be introduced by configuring plugins available at
https://collectd.org/wiki/index.php/Table_of_Plugins.

example scrape output:

--------
collectd_check_openstack_api_gauge{check_openstack_api="ceilometer-api",instance="40ad2d53a7dc" 0 1507096547649
collectd_check_openstack_api_gauge{check_openstack_api="nova-api",instance="40ad2d53a7dc" 1 1507096547649
collectd_processes_ps_pagefaults_minflt_total{processes="collectd",instance="ubuntu-xenial" 0 1507221316671

commit_message:
WIP - collectd chart to collect metrics

collectd Python plugin has been utilized in this chart to
collect openstack api check metrics. Metrics yet to be implemented:
IPMI, AMQP, MySQL, Port Check metrics, URL GET metrics etc.

Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

Change-Id: Ib70a06dcde1e0743983076645fd82c0fa67d2e2c

commit_message:
Remove legacy tox-func jobs

The dib-utils repo using this job now uses the openstack-tox-functional job
instead, so remove the legacy job.

Change-Id: I1d5d2097b9610b4e1768e98532810dd55bbcb523
Depends-On: Ifa4c20cff72820a0016bef8dcdd36647ae7359d3

subject: networking-midonet: Exclude centos-7 jobs from ocata
messages:
[{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2017-11-06 09:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-06 14:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-07 02:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think we can fix this, rather than ignore it...'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-07 03:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@tony, i think we were just talking about this in the infra session; updated centos libvirt version.  are we looking at updating constraints on stable for this?'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2017-11-07 04:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ian,

of course, i prefer fixing it over this patch.
but i don't have any idea how to fix it right now. (thus this patch)
if someone can fix it, please go ahead.  it seems networking-midonet is not the only project affected by the issue. (see the logstash query in the related-bug)"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2017-11-07 15:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 09:05:20.000000000', 'message': 'networking-midonet: Exclude centos-7 jobs from ocata

Ocata version of libvirt-python (2.5.0) seems incompatible
with libvirt in the image.  (libvirt-3.2.0-14.el7_4.3.x86_64)

Related-Bug: #1730314
Change-Id: I91fbf1a001325605bdf69508c8d2eeb4bff09dbf
'}]
commit_message:
networking-midonet: Exclude centos-7 jobs from ocata

Ocata version of libvirt-python (2.5.0) seems incompatible
with libvirt in the image.  (libvirt-3.2.0-14.el7_4.3.x86_64)

Related-Bug: #1730314
Change-Id: I91fbf1a001325605bdf69508c8d2eeb4bff09dbf

Create openstack-tox-functional-py35 job

A couple of repos use a functional-py35 job, let's give them a shared
job.

commit_message:
Remove unused tox-functional jobs

Every project now uses the openstack-tox-functional job, remove
unused project specific ones.

Change-Id: I87be25a6c87b90e5f3219624a74a3a15440af0c8

commit_message:
Dockerhub publisher job

This patchset includes pushing mechanism for daily periodic jobs.

except it copies the script over to the host rather than depending on a

Fix check-requirements

Fix check-requirements: The assumptions with remote branch are not valid
anymore with Zuul v3, the change is on the proposed branch, check against
HEAD^1 instead.

Use the command module instead of script to get stdout in the
job-output.txt.gz file. Zuul v3 currently will not record the output from script
module in that file, only when command is used.

Note that the script module copied the file to the remote system - the
system where the tests are run - while command does not do this. But
the command is already on the remote system, use correct path for it.

new cross-check-job.

commit_message:
Add copy project-config's legacy-requirements-cross-* jobs

These are going to be rewritten to native zuulv3 jobs
in the next commit.

Needed-By: I3b0dbdcc02a0a8cff0c52701fadf7632648afb97
Change-Id: I3b9a86528350242c4d785d0f49c318de6c29ec75
Closes-Bug: #1730673

Add requirements-check job

This is a straight copy of the original gate-{name}-requirements job,
except it copies the script over to the host rather than depending on a
baked-in copy of the script. Followups should rework it to stop using
zuul-cloner.

(jlk) updated to fix pep8 errors so that the patch can land.

Change-Id: I734db3b3e4d445e15084d1ca6e60cf2fe392385d

Fix check-requirements

Fix check-requirements: The assumptions with remote branch are not valid
anymore with Zuul v3, the change is on the proposed branch, check against
HEAD^1 instead.

Use the command module instead of script to get stdout in the
job-output.txt.gz file. Zuul v3 currently will not record the output from script
module in that file, only when command is used.

Note that the script module copied the file to the remote system - the
system where the tests are run - while command does not do this. But
the command is already on the remote system, use correct path for it.

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: Ib44332b4daf63b9d3fca6eadf0b4825614ca4aeb

Add a Zuul v3 native cross-check job

Convert the existing legacy-cross-* jobs over to the
new cross-check-job.

Adds a small bump to upper-constraints in order to test
the success of this review.

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Change-Id: Iba6a025e3a10185ad1d8217244b967713cace3f6

commit_message:
Create replacement resource atomically

Use a single transaction to create the replacement resource and set it as
the replaced_by link in the old resource. Also, ensure that no other
traversal has taken a lock on the old resource before we modify it.

If we end up bailing out and not creating a replacement or sending an RPC
message to check it, make sure we retrigger any new traversal.

Change-Id: I23db4f06a4060f3d26a78f7b26700de426f355e3
Closes-Bug: #1727128

commit_message:
Advertise IPv6 support in the NetApp driver

Escape IPv6 exports correctly and setup the default export
policy to allow both IPv4 and IPv6.

Partially implements: bp netapp-ontap-ipv6-support

Change-Id: I84437b140e2a9561cc4092683209800101f45815

Looks good, but Jenkins is not happy for some reason.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2017-10-23 14:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Looks good, but Jenkins is not happy for some reason.

Hi, Xing: Jenkins was failing unit test jobs because it was ignoring the Upper Constraints file specified in our tox.ini. It tried to grab the upper-constraints corresponding to the "driverfixes/newton" branch but failed to do that because there's no such branch in openstack/requirements. We want the upper constraints on these driverfixes branches to fall back to the corresponding stable branch (in this case stable/newton): https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/driverfixes/newton/tox.ini#L9

Zuul V3 enforces this check from our tox.ini. 

Also, infra killed Jenkins last week :)'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2017-10-23 14:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can this be merged with a -1 from Jenkins?'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2017-10-23 16:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Can this be merged with a -1 from Jenkins?

Yep, it can be, like these ones: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged+project:openstack/manila+branch:driverfixes/newton'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2017-10-23 16:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Fix share server deletion

The DHSS=True cDOT driver can be used with non-segmented
networks, and the driver should not assume that network
interfaces are always assigned to VLAN ports.

Change-Id: Ifffae0f5e42d16ea40d693116b720c7f7d57c971
Closes-Bug: #1698250
(cherry picked from commit abe3224774ebbad0aa22365b647a381efa28ec49)
(cherry picked from commit 194c1152ab971966f35717428e743f011721ee61)
(cherry picked from commit c3dbe188fc748729b7b846286decd5257a3a8c56)

commit_message:
Add Puppet package to bindep, for module build

We need Puppet package deployed from bindep so we can
run puppet module build with the new zuul v3 job.

Change-Id: Ia1da87f968b59bc84b7589fbddaa216f8c62b1e0

commit_message:
Increase minimum puppetlabs-stdlib version requirement

ensure_resources which is used in the 'ceph::osds' and 'ceph::conf'
classes only came in at 4.12.0 so increase version to that.

Change-Id: I2141523b9bf295d3f5297b714faa2897b2d2d66f

commit_message:
Make sure pg_num is updated before pgp_num.

We need to order the change because pgp makes a check on the pg
number.

Closes-Bug: #1730457

Change-Id: I2983de1448ce4e4bbbfffb970a1d0f082854d879

commit_message:
Split make_pickleable to two functions.

Since vitrage support the creation of new drivers,
make_pickleable function can be used for various drivers,
including drivers which outside of openstack vitrage.
In order to enable drivers to use make_pickleable func
without adding end_message (use case example: pagination
purposes), make_pickleable was split to two function:
make_pickleable_with_end_message-will be equivalent to the
old make_pickleable.
The new make_pickleable func will not add end_messge_flag.

Change-Id: I5e817f691e2628f48c6fb407506be555389c12c2

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs into tree

This patch moves the legacy ironic-python-agent CI jobs into the
tree instead of storing them in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs
to give us control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the new ansible
roles.

Change-Id: I7f98258589954639fa8187a3fec4a0b9da05915d
(cherry picked from commit e9c845553bcea3a8f1435037e3bb94bc37354f94)

commit_message:
Follow up Secure boot support for irmc-virtual-media driver

This commit makes changes based upon review feedback
in I13961aaf6e26591f724d5f52d0a503c71eb6824a.
- Updates documentation describes secure boot configuration details
- Updates test code

Change-Id: Iedb1507566f7792ce3749779c0687137f26adead
