[{'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-25 01:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-07-25 01:36:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-25 01:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/1/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/66b0150//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 15s'}, {'account_id': 21414, 'date': '2017-07-25 02:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some initial suggestion on format

1. wrap the long lines to 80 columns so it is easier to review in gerrit, 
2. indent the source code as http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/stable/rest.html#source-code , note also the double colon.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-25 05:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-25 05:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/2/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/6a834cd//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 52s'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-07-25 06:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Hi, and welcome to Vitrage :-)

I wrote a few comments in the rst file, and I also have two general comments:

1. According to everything you wrote, I would expect the SNMP service to be a regular datasource. Can you please explain why you want it to be a service that sends the traps to other datasources? note that if this is the selected solution, you will have to address issues like the service life cycle, etc.

2. Pike feature freeze is at the end of this week, and the release in a month or so. So unless you think you can finish the implementation really quickly, this feature will be done in Queens. Please consider moving the spec to specs/queens/approved folder. If you do want it in Pike, then please move it to the (newly created) "approved" folder under specs/pike.'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-25 07:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-25 07:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/3/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/c72dd67//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 50s'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-25 07:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-07-25 11:17:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Hi,

Thanks for the explanation. I have some more questions:

1. When you say that the listener distributes it to the corresponding datasource - what datasource is that? can you give an example of a specific alarm, with an end-to-end use case? 

2. Messages to datasources don't have to arrive via RabbitMq. Why not write the SNMP parsing service as a standard datasource driver, that just has a different kind of input?"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-07-25 11:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-26 01:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-26 01:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/4/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/dec3ec0//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 29s'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-26 02:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

1.We add two new datasources for alarms from IAAS and PAAS environments, which report alarms by snmp. For example, a parsed message like {"type": "iaas_alarm", "details":　snmp_parsed_message} will be distributed to datasource "iaas_alarm".
2.If SNMP parsing service is a datasource, all alarms reported by snmp method will be all  in this datasource, and they correspond to diff resource types. Besides, all the alarms may have diff confs, then they may be not so clear and easy to understand?'}, {'account_id': 24635, 'date': '2017-07-26 06:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-07-26 07:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Ok, I understand. A few other questions:

- Are the datasources going to be general, or ZTE specific? what resources are they going to refer?

- Will the SNMP service be general, and be able to parse SNMP traps coming from other environments as well?

- Have a look at the Vitrage system architecture diagrams:

https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/_images/vitrage_graph_architecture.png

https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/vitrage-ha-and-history-vision.html

Where in the diagrams would you place the new service? 

- Service installation and life cycle: who will be responsible for that? will it be part of the devstack? will it support HA? 

- Will the service support SNMP Get as well? consider a situation that Vitrage was restarted. Will you be able to get the currently active traps?

- Reminding you of the technical issue: please move the blueprint under specs/queens/approved (unless you believe it can be ready really quickly, and then please move it under specs/pike/approved folder).'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-27 03:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-27 03:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/5/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/ca5db3b//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 57s'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-07-29 04:55:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

1.The datasources for alarms of IAAS/PAAS environment will be ZTE specific, and the resources they referred to 
will be chassis/server/host... (for IAAS), or tenant/service...(for PAAS).
2. SNMP service is designed to be general for parsing SNMP traps from all SNMP-supported environments.
3. For vitrage_graph_architecture.png, snmp service will be between datasources(Nova, Cinder...) and Oslo Messaging Bus, and the other picture is 404 for now.
4. The service can support HA, and it works no matter how the environment is deployed. Actually I don't know whether it be part of the devstack, and it has not be decided yet.
5. Active traps will not be parsed when vitrage is restaring. We have an interface to get all the history active traps, and the alarms will not be lost after all.By the way, what do you mean by SNMP Get?"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-07-30 09:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

1. + 2. What I'm trying to understand is if the SNMP service should be a general-purpose service (which could be great), or ZTE specific (which should not be pushed to Vitrage upstream). Please see my comment inside the rst regarding this issue.

3. So will the diagram contain something like that?

SNMP manager1 ---+---> SNMP parsing service ----> RabbitMQ
                                  |
SNMP manager2 ---|

An updated link to the other picture: https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/contributor/vitrage-ha-and-history-vision.html

4. OK. Just note that Vitrage now has an install guide, so you will need to document how this new service is installed.

5. SNMP has 3 main functions : Traps, SNMP Get, and SNMP Set. SNMP Protocol is UDP, so some of the traps won't reach the SNMP manager. That's why traps are tracked according to a serial number, and "GET" is used to collect the missed traps. The SNMP manager will not be able to manage / record all alarms without the "GET". "GET" can be implemented at a later stage, but should not be omitted from the rst. 

Furthermore, if Vitrage is down for some time, the accepted method to match the data is to perform a "get all", so your IaaS/PasS datasources will need a way to get all current traps from the SNMP service.

6. If I understand correctly, you plan to store the traps and be able to retrieve them later? where do you plan to store them?'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-08-11 06:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

1. + 2. SNMP service is a general-purpose service.
3. Yes. In the vitrage_graph_architecture.png, it will be 
    external system ---> SNMP parsing service ---> RabbitMq. 
    Should I submit a graph including SNMP parsing service?
4. SNMP service can be part of devstack and also support HA in the future. 
   The installing of snmp service is similar to api service, and it is powered on after running vitrage. The install guide will be mainly about configuration of SNMP service. Besides, is it the current install guide for vitrage?
   https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/install/install-rdo.html
   Where should I submit the SNMP install guide?
5. + 6. The SNMP manager can't be able to manage all the alarms since there may be missed traps, and SNMP parsing service will not get traps if Vitrage is down. SNMP parsing service provides a data channel, not datasource itself. Each datasource can use "get_all" of driver.py to deal with the problem of missing traps.
7. SNMP configuration:
   a. Yes, SNMP conf will be in vitrage.conf.
   b. + c. We plan to configure snmp parsing service by .yaml file. The port and default coding way are common, this part is in vitrage.conf, and oid mappings will be in snmp_parsing.yaml since mapping relationships are different for diff systems.
     
	# snmp listening port (integer value)
	#snmp_listening_port = 8162

	# default decode protocol(string value)
	#default_coding = iso-8859-1

	# traps oid mapping yaml file path(string value)
	#oid_mapping = /etc/vitrage/snmp_parsing_conf.yaml'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-08-14 07:21:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

3. Ok. The architecture.png is based on a Gliffy diagram that I have. I think it will be much more simple if I add the service and send you a new png for your approval (and don't hesitate to ask for changes). Since the png is part of vitrage and not vitrage-specs, we can do it later.

4. You should update the install guide under https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/install/. I'm not sure exactly where, we can discuss it at a later stage. And you should also update the devstack installation. All is needed now is to add a task to the spec saying that the install guide + devstack script should be updated.

5+6. Let me see if I got it right. You have datasources that query data using non-SNMP get_all (REST API or something else), and get notifications using SNMP? so you don't need to take care about losing a notifications in the SNMP service, because your datasource will get updated in the next non-SNMP get_all?

If this is the case then I'm fine with it. Just please add a comment about it in the spec, saying that your solution does not support lost notifications at the moment (if someone else needs it in the future, he will have to enhance the SNMP service).

7. a. Ok

b. + c. Ok, please update the spec accordingly. And please add an example of the snmp_parsing_conf.yaml file. Can there be more than one file at the time?"}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-08-18 09:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-08-18 09:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

5+6. Yes. The snmp parsing solution does not support lost notifications for now, and our datasources support querying current alarms in get_all by RESTFUL API.
7. There is just one snmp_parsing_conf.yaml, and all the snmp parsing configs will be in this file for different systems. The spec has been updated, thks~'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-18 10:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/12/486812/6/check/gate-vitrage-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/574b645//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 57s'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-08-31 08:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

> 5+6. Yes. The snmp parsing solution does not support lost

OK

 > 7. There is just one snmp_parsing_conf.yaml, and all the snmp

if 'PaaS' == snmp_trap[alarm_type_oid]:  # oid_key,oid_value
    return "paas_alarm.alarm"           # which datasource this trap should
                                           #be distributed to'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-09-07 13:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

> if 'PaaS' == snmp_trap[alarm_type_oid]:  # oid_key,oid_value

Where does this code reside? in the SNMP service? 
I'm sorry but I still don't fully understand...

So assuming you have the following details:

- oid_key: 1.3.6.1.4.1.3902.4101.1.3.1.12
- system: PaaS
- datasource: nova.instance

What is the meaning of "paas_alarm.alarm"?'}, {'account_id': 25301, 'date': '2017-09-08 01:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

It is event_type to receive notifications.For example:

if trap[oid_key] == oid_value:
    return all_drivers[datasource].get_event_types()

Actually, oid_key is the same in one system...'}, {'account_id': 21414, 'date': '2017-09-09 06:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> It is event_type to receive notifications.For example:
 > 
 > if trap[oid_key] == oid_value:
 > return all_drivers[datasource].get_event_types()

List the related configuration to help understanding

        - oid_key: 1.3.6.1.4.1.3902.4101.1.3.1.12(for example)
          oid_value: Nova(defined by different systems)
          datasource: nova

When an snmp trap is received, the snmp parsing service iterates through the configuration to see if it matches any item. If so, it is considered as an event for the specified datasource.

How the conversion from trap to graph still needs further clarification'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-09-11 19:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

So sorry, but I still don't get it...

 > datasource: nova
 > 
 > When an snmp trap is received, the snmp parsing service iterates
 > through the configuration to see if it matches any item. 
The snmp service iterates the oid_keys, right?

 > If so, it
 > is considered as an event for the specified datasource.
Ok. So the "specified datasource" is nova? (or actually nova.instance or nova.host)
But what is the oid_value "Nova" used for? and what do you mean in the comment "defined by different systems"?

 > How the conversion from trap to graph still needs further
 > clarification
What do you mean? isn't it the role of the datasource?'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-09-11 19:57:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

The last comment formatting didn't work so well... I hope you can identify my questions between your comments"}, {'account_id': 21414, 'date': '2017-09-12 03:38:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> The snmp service iterates the oid_keys, right?

Yes, but oid_value are also used for mapping trap to datasource

 > Ok. So the "specified datasource" is nova? (or actually
 > nova.instance or nova.host)

Yes

 > But what is the oid_value "Nova" used for? and what do you mean in
 > the comment "defined by different systems"?

SNMP is consider an **external** source, it is likely it enclose none openstack terminology in a trap. For example, the host information in ZTE comes from `IaaS`, but it should be map to `nova.host`

 > > How the conversion from trap to graph still needs further
 > > clarification
 > What do you mean? isn't it the role of the datasource?

For datasource, the flow is like (external events)==[datasource driver]==>(entity events)==[datasource transformer]==>(graph). My question was what would be the interface between snmp parsing service and datasource. As external events? Which means we need to patch each datasource driver to interpret such event.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2017-09-12 19:49:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Ok, so let's see if I got it this time:

oid_key: 1.3.6.1.4.1.3902.4101.1.3.1.12 (for example)
system: Iaas (defined by a system external to OpenStack)
datasource: nova.intance

The SNMP parsing service will create an external event with all these parameters and send it to the message bus. Some of the datasource drivers will listen to some of these events and will pass the events to the transformers.

Is that what you meant?"}, {'account_id': 21414, 'date': '2017-09-25 03:52:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Move legacy ironic-lib jobs in-tree

This patch moves the legacy ironic-lib CI jobs into the ironic-lib
tree instead of storing them in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs
to give us control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the new ansible
roles.

Change-Id: Id9b0c22b73135ca0e9a952e909e8295550ad899f
(cherry picked from commit 5ab2d5c67a60078eb34ccd6fb28fcc90d0247a11)

I think the point of this patch (If I understand it), is that you noticed some sort of discrepancy with this job in the first patch in the series.

And that it turns out that we should have been running this in gate, cuz it was being run in gate prior to the zuul v3 migration. Right? (And if this is right, it would have been useful to have it in the commit, but our comments here document it in case someone wonders later.)'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Update Zuul 'gate' job

Have the Zuul 'gate' job
'ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa' run on
master. This job runs in the Zuul 'check' job for master, so it should
also run in the 'gate' job. Although there are other jobs in 'check'
that aren't in 'gate', the others are non-voting. This one was in gate
prior to the migration to zuul v3. This fixes it so it is in gate again.

Change-Id: I9120dcf0b910759f60a4915c84388653922292e8

commit_message:
Move processing of local_gb to root_disk_selection hook

The scheduling hook will be deprecated, so handling local_gb (useful
e.g. for image size validation) needs a new home.

Change-Id: I29041879dea8a2d7f2abc6a988d4814ee121442e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-21 14:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the "dns_domain" option by default

The "dns_domain" option needs to end in a "." to have a proper DNS name.
This change adds the sinle period and quites the string.

Change-Id: I000137b4071ea9ee2fae00eef7dfa4fa9fcadf3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 95a3e0abf2210086531f4e0dae5cc98fde36b749)
'}, {'created': '2017-08-29 16:04:36.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the "dns_domain" option by default

commit_message:
Correct the "dns_domain" option by default

The "dns_domain" option needs to end in a "." to have a proper DNS name.
This change adds the sinle period and quites the string.

Change-Id: I000137b4071ea9ee2fae00eef7dfa4fa9fcadf3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 95a3e0abf2210086531f4e0dae5cc98fde36b749)

will check this behavior soon before commenting'}, {'account_id': 23479, 'date': '2017-04-27 13:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)

kolla-toolbox return json object instead of just plain string.So, when, first one(external DB) failed, resultant json object will have 'msg' field, , hence 'changed' set to True - 
   "mysql_access": {
        "changed": false,
        "failed": false,
        "failed_when_result": false,
        "msg": "unable to find /var/lib/ansible/.my.cnf. Exception message: (1045, \"Access denied for user 'ceilometer'@'control1RU6' (using password: YES)\")"
    }

If the DB already exist, then, returned json object will NOT contain 'msg' field, hence 'changed' set to False- 
  "mysql_access": {
        "changed": false,
        "db": "ceilometer",
        "failed": false,
        "failed_when_result": false
    }'}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2017-04-27 13:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Eduardo, there should be other way, e.g. modifying the first task so that it returns more comprehensible result'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-04-27 14:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think we have two options here:  
  
First check ceilometer_database_mysql_address is available, e.g. by using 'wait_for'. If it's up, try creating the database, if that fails, fail the task. If's down, proceed to using the internal database.
This has a problem though as the default for the ceilometer_database_mysql_address is set to the internal vip which complicates things.  
  
The second option is to leave the decision up to the user. So allow "ceilometer_database_type" to have a value of one of mongodb/mysql/mysql-external. This simplifies the logic and avoids unintended consequences, at the cost of the user having to set one more variable.  
  
Personally I'm leaning towards option two.'}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2017-04-28 09:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I somewhat agree with Paul on failback strategy - if customer wants external she/he should get it or be notified with a failure. With failback approach the error will go unnoticed. I suggest to have to tasks - one if ceilometer db address != database address (external case) and another is when ceilometer db address is untouched and equal to internal db.'}, {'account_id': 13671, 'date': '2017-04-28 15:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-28 15:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

with "failed_when: False" the only way to say task failed is existence of "msg" in result. If access check fails "msg" has mysql exception, otherwise "msg" is not there.

e.g.

TASK [ceilometer : Checking access to Ceilometer MySQL database] ***************
task path: /usr/share/kolla/ansible/roles/ceilometer/tasks/bootstrap.yml:12
ok: [10.196.244.201] => {"changed": false, "failed": false, "failed_when_result": false, "invocation": {"module_args": {"module_args": {"login_host": "10.196.245.201", "login_password": "password22", "login_port": "3306", "login_user": "ceilometer", "name": "ceilometer"}, "module_extra_vars": null, "module_name": "mysql_db"}, "module_name": "kolla_toolbox"}, "msg": "unable to find /var/lib/ansible/.my.cnf. Exception message: (1045, \"Access denied for user 'ceilometer'@'control1' (using password: YES)\")"}

TASK [ceilometer : debug] ******************************************************
task path: /usr/share/kolla/ansible/roles/ceilometer/tasks/bootstrap.yml:28
ok: [10.196.244.202] => {
    "mysql_database_access": {
        "changed": false, 
        "failed": false, 
        "failed_when_result": false, 
        "msg": "unable to find /var/lib/ansible/.my.cnf. Exception message: (1045, \"Access denied for user 'ceilometer'@'control1' (using password: YES)\")"
    }
}

Looks like the module does not provide us with anything else.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2017-05-10 15:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Fix MySQL DB create failure detection mechanism

When external Ceilometer MySQL database create fails we should not
fallback to create internal one - this is probably not what user would
expect.

By default ceilometer_database_mysql_address points to internal db.
We can check if it is so by testing given database with admin rights.
If we have admin rights it is internal database and therefore we create
Ceilometer user and database. If database is external / there are no
admin rights we ensure Ceilometer database and user already exist.

This fix also triggers bootstrapping of database by checking Ceilometer
tables - this is the only possibility for external database.

Change-Id: I880172ebf71a4c2682905d7aba5e6438be06db12

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Ib83267ef75f91fb8f95af312d644ebe19c6307c9
(cherry picked from commit d482b16ca31c79bb614a5d967511d7ec56e1723b)
(cherry picked from commit 14b17ebd31efae8b886ba95786836949751a5c39)

(1 comment)

I might be missing something again, but setting -1 to make sure you see this.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-09-28 03:08:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Isn't there still a race here?

Yeah, there is. To me the whole replace workflow looks racy. We set the original resource IN_PROGRESS, do validations, raise UpdateReplace and mark the existing resource as UPDATE_COMPLETE[1] and release the lock, before doing the prepare_for_replace stuff.

Also, as we cleanup the old resource only after the new resource is created and it looks to me that there are plenty of opportunities for race conditions.

Do you've any better idea on how to handle this?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resource.py#L846-L847"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-10-04 19:18:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The prepare_for_replace() thing was added a year after convergence was designed, so it was never taken into account in the design. If it fails we set the resource state to FAILED, so I think we should do it while we're holding the lock in the case that UpdateReplace is raised by handle_update(). (That's unusual though; usually we raise it before we even take the lock... not even sure what to do there. If we're going to do work I'd say we should mark the resource IN_PROGRESS and take the lock.)

This patch appears to purely be protecting Resource.make_replacement(), since an RPC check_resource message is sent immediately after that, and that will check the traversal ID when it is received. We have a foreign key constraint so that it will refuse to create the replacement if it points to a non-existent template. We should handle that exception appropriately. We should also do the update to the current resource (setting its replaced_by field) in the same transaction where we create the replacement. And finally, when we update the current resource we should ensure that the atomic_key has not been modified so that we don't overwrite any subsequent changes."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-10-06 03:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-06 04:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(3 comments)

Mmmm, I guess this is OK. We can't fail to retrigger like we could before. However, we could still get into a situation where the make_replacement() fails in ugly ways (with big ERROR messages in the log), and in the worst case we can still write the resource status as COMPLETE in the DB when a subsequent traversal has already locked the resource. Those can only be addressed by fixing make_replacement() directly."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Bah, inline comments from yesterday that I forgot to post.

I do think that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514888/ is the only way to fix all of the issues. I'm relaxed about this going in first as a partial fix, it definitely improves things, but if I'm able to get the other one working then there's probably no pressing need."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-02 15:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

OK, tests are passing now on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514888/ and that should be a more comprehensive fix - if you agree then I don't think we need this patch any more."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-11-07 12:34:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514888/'}]

commit_message:
Don't create a replacement resource if the traversal has changed

During UpdateReplace of resource, when preparing for replacement,
if some service calls takes time (ex.InterfaceDetach), then by the
time replacement is to be created, the raw_template used by that
traversal would probably not be even available.

Do an additional check for current_traversal before going ahead and
creating a replacement. If the traversal has changed, we should
call retrigger_check_resource instead of creating the replacement.

This also reverts the changes in 99b055b42357e2fae6006fe150c3c47c30dab1c0
to not check for traversal change again after receiving the check
message for the new resource.

There is another big issue as you would probably end up with a server
with it's interfaces detached after the rollback.

Change-Id: Iefa934d00c3655f9956191d89effca5c7b3f1020
Closes-Bug: #1727146

commit_message:
Allow ZAPI over IPv6

When an IPv6 literal is specified in manila.conf for the
netapp_hostname option, automatically URL-escape it.

Closes-bug: 1730509

Change-Id: Id55e870066b6a669da83aa6a96f74ea76d6103bd

Purge doc of references to nova net

since support for nova network was removed back in Ocata [1] [2].

Also fix a self-referential link.

[1] 0f33dcf62b61547e54011e831f3af939e472e5bc

[2] I8b9a559fbea61979f01737ed1dc272276c4f1269

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7f7fdcbf72c2ed38a9141977a0b48dc3fec2f46e

commit_message:
Update tox_install.sh for zuulv3

This patch will allow tox_install.sh to find the zuulv3 checked out version
of horizon.

Change-Id: Ief05fea76d06c4e93eff96de7f7e7a3b3ae3934b

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to openstack-ansible repo

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: Ibc4aceb33c8123330cedad7eb4ac4bb2c30ea84a
Co-Authored-By: Kien Nguyen <KienNT@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Update idrac hardware type documentation

This change introduces a minimum page for the iDRAC drivers with
dependency installation, configuration and enrolling.

I'll leave it up to the driver team to provide further updates.

Change-Id: If0805cb0f73ac3888711c1908dc8faaa34f7e0ec

commit_message:
Migrating legacy jobs

Moving legacy jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs to manila
repository. In order for us to start reworking the legacy
jobs to native v3 jobs, we need to do so.
This is the first step as described in the manual
and will also make it easier to remove the in-tree
tempest plugin sooner.

Change-Id: I7c9fbbb22860a1d246a8e6cb834f7c87875344f2

commit_message:
Using --option ARGUMENT

The OpenStack CLI commands support both --option ARGUMENT and --option=ARGUMENT.
In technical publications, use --option ARGUMENT.[1]

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ia6d587bbea3d71533fa6f859e7e34aac4c594d8e

messages:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 10:01:21.000000000', 'message': "Ensure sshd has proper configuration for its HostKey.

Since DSA is deprecated, sshd doesn't generate it anymore, though it
still wants to load it at startup. Adding the HostKey options should
prevent that, and allow to get cleaner logs in the CI (and on deployed
openstack as well ;).

Change-Id: I5580fa86f8adef7d598b76836a0419b341a8bc9c
Closes-Bug: 1730351
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure sshd has proper configuration for its HostKey.

Since DSA is deprecated, sshd doesn't generate it anymore, though it
still wants to load it at startup. Adding the HostKey options should
prevent that, and allow to get cleaner logs in the CI (and on deployed
openstack as well ;).

Change-Id: I5580fa86f8adef7d598b76836a0419b341a8bc9c
Closes-Bug: 1730351

commit_message:
Post deployment installation instructions for container-based Octavia

Post deployment installation instructions for Octavia

While Octavia services are installed, full Octavia support is
in-progress. This documentation describes general steps necessary to get
the system ready for creating load balancers in container-based overcloud
environment.

Change-Id: I09e7ec2563c5fdc2c3988c2858fb74f967241d35

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 17:22:21.000000000', 'message': "Protect against race within os.path.realpath

On iSCSI connections, when we are making sure that there no links remain
like /dev/disk/by-id/scsi-* we make several calls to os.path.realpath
which normal behavior is:

- If file path doesn't exist, returns the same file path
- If file path exists, return the real path

But there is a third option, and that is when the file did exist but it
dissapear right when the  call to os.readlink in posixpath:_joinrealpath

   path, ok = _joinrealpath(path, os.readlink(newpath), seen)

Which ends up raising an exception such as:

   OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
            '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-20024f40058540081'

And because of this exception the detach will fail when it shouldn't.

This patch adds includes the call to os.path.realpath within a
try...except clause to prevent this race condition from unexpectely
making the detach operation fail.

Change-Id: Ieb58826b28c62094c941fce10863c0a75fb4e8aa
Closes-Bug: #1719719
(cherry picked from commit de89635ab70b36852d638efd6e45d245217613cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Protect against race within os.path.realpath

On iSCSI connections, when we are making sure that there no links remain
like /dev/disk/by-id/scsi-* we make several calls to os.path.realpath
which normal behavior is:

- If file path doesn't exist, returns the same file path
- If file path exists, return the real path

But there is a third option, and that is when the file did exist but it
dissapear right when the  call to os.readlink in posixpath:_joinrealpath

   path, ok = _joinrealpath(path, os.readlink(newpath), seen)

Which ends up raising an exception such as:

   OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
            '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-20024f40058540081'

And because of this exception the detach will fail when it shouldn't.

This patch adds includes the call to os.path.realpath within a
try...except clause to prevent this race condition from unexpectely
making the detach operation fail.

Change-Id: Ieb58826b28c62094c941fce10863c0a75fb4e8aa
Closes-Bug: #1719719
(cherry picked from commit de89635ab70b36852d638efd6e45d245217613cc)

commit_message:
Reverting generate MySQL client config for Octavia

It seems there's a bug with generating MySQL client config for
Octavia. this patch reverts the change so it will be possible
for now to deploy overcloud containerized with Octavia.
origin change in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/481965
bug opened for that issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1712368

commit_message:
Update and replace http with https for doc links in cloudkitty

1) Update doc links according to OpenStack document migration
2) Use https instead of http for docs links

Change-Id: Ia64e1e0c9d4461abdf73ab1f53c1de935f1c825d

When the "cdrom" device associated to the configdrive ,
which no longer has a "source" element.

It is a normal and expected situation which shouldn't generate any logs.

Closes-Bug: #1729506

commit_message:
Fix bug for ceilometer polling generates an exception

When the "cdrom" device associated to the configdrive ,
which no longer has a "source" element.

It is a normal and expected situation which shouldn't generate any logs.

Change-Id: Ia9910f6aec1b2cc8db99d8468e42b840b387130c
Closes-Bug: #1729506
(cherry picked from commit a141c6da5d5558b0be4b634015c4adbe815f6f28)

commit_message:
Enable neutron-destroy-port-patches service

Change https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/10145/ introduced a new
systemd service. We need to enable the service to take effect.

Change-Id: I54b7d0ef46c90ee827d440d3cb0c485090e749d5
Related: rhbz#1490281
Closes-bug: #1726777

Optimize the link address in docs

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information.Deleted some invalid URLs.

Tempest refactoring

move code around so useful methods are in a common place.
create a clients singleton holding all required clients for testing.

commit_message:
Add error handling and logging to CNI daemon

This adds error handling and improves logging in CNI daemon. Besides
that unit tests for new codepaths are added.

Co-Authored-By: Janonymous <janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint cni-split-exec-daemon
Change-Id: Ieff94a5c0b85e8d958421fc4db2f09a411f4e667

[{'created': '2017-10-09 13:37:25.000000000', 'message': "Remove 99-loopback.conf

Turns out 99-loopback.conf file isn't really required when running
kuryr-kubernetes. This commit removes its installation from DevStack
plugin and CNI Docker image.

Change-Id: I8f2097287df907675c4113cd225a7ee9f6cd7ef1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 99-loopback.conf

Turns out 99-loopback.conf file isn't really required when running
kuryr-kubernetes. This commit removes its installation from DevStack
plugin and CNI Docker image.

Change-Id: I8f2097287df907675c4113cd225a7ee9f6cd7ef1

commit_message:
Introduce overwrite/clear functionality in ``osc project set``

The overwrite functionality allows user to overwrite/clear
the property of a specific project.

Change-Id: I361e3cbd3475fae3e7db128047cf6bec19b13c8a
partially-implements: blueprint allow-overwrite-set-options

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 04:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I249362c405587942769518642b2a3df1df8d5fe0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I249362c405587942769518642b2a3df1df8d5fe0

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - search (2)

This commit migrate all event search policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I803b247834bcd31c572c7a83d0f95c05c4be6fd2

commit_message:
Implement basic policy module in code (1)

This change prepares the searchlight project to start implementing
policies in code. Subsequent patches will register more searchlight
policies in code and remove the corresponding entry from the policy
file maintained in source.
This is part of a community effort to provide better user experience
for those having to maintain RBAC policy.
More information on this effort can be found below:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: Ic3949a892df7b0a9ec2a8a189583bd72e0e031e8
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

commit_message:
check query param for used_limits function

Add additional schema check for used_limit query function,
as we need backward compatible those changes, here we don't do real
check and later a microversion need to be done to do the real check.

Part of blueprint json-schema-validation-for-query-param

Change-Id: I32ea7481aad3988f816e4d6511b6ffb2ca68586c

commit_message:
Use functional tox environment

Create new functional tox environment so that we can use it instead of
func environment to allow creation of cross-project
openstack-tox-functional job.

Depends-On: Ibebf9d0eeccabaefa2777a43592a72d19d064b6b
Needed-By: Ifa4c20cff72820a0016bef8dcdd36647ae7359d3
Change-Id: Ied08d83177b9d52b6eb8e4987f444230ac4ebfdb

commit_message:
Add python-rsdclient into plugin list

Intel RSD is new architecture that disaggregates compute, storage,
and network resources, and provide the ability to dynamically compose
resources based on workload-specific demands [1]. The python-rsdclient
project provide specific RSD plugin to allow user to invoke RSD API
through OpenStackClient. So Added it into existing plugin list.

[1] https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/architecture-and-technology/rack-scale-design-overview.html

Change-Id: Ic49efddfb003c89ece6d782905b27fb46402b3ab

commit_message:
Fix a bug in libvirt driver

When the vm booting from a vm, but it created failed and then we
needed to clean it up. But we cannot delete it for the bug in code.

Change-Id: I1f45318d480f1324f14ba23f56caf5dba7a12c13
Closes-Bug: 1730549

commit_message:
Add icmp sg rules to k8s project

This commit adds a sg rule to k8s project sg so pods there can reply to
ping for testing purpouses. By default it only enables ingress rules but
the functions could be extended depending on future requirements.

Partially implements: bp functional-testing-catch-up

Change-Id: I1e3f88a007260b485b246a3a3e12d41bc06983b2

commit_message:
Use functional tox environment

Rename func to function tox environment and replace custom
legacy func job with cross-project openstack-tox-functional job.

Leave func as shim for current users, notify them via a releasenote of
the change.

Change-Id: I104433ac72ab3d48dacdcd67b36111093f600d4e
Depends-On: Ibebf9d0eeccabaefa2777a43592a72d19d064b6b

commit_message:
Address all rabbit units in clustered deploy

If rabbitmq is deployed in a cluster then the ceilometer charm will
pass rabbitmq_hosts and rabbitmq_host to ceilometer-agent. This charm
was ignoring the rabbitmq_hosts key and thus always talking to a
single rabbit even if there were multiple.

Change-Id: I42c2e3ee4ee2bd1feb9815a4d9895a7121801995
Closes-Bug: #1670273

commit_message:
Add network space support for HA API endpoints

Switch to using the get_relation_ip helper when resolving
internal, public and admin endpoint network configuration,
providing compatibility with Juju 2.0 network spaces.

Change-Id: Ia6fbf479259b50d938b6798ca17e5dc073c99812

subject: Do not use “-y” for package install
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 04:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Iea6dae250ae7760f09090ddfa1f50e56b69ce43c
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Iea6dae250ae7760f09090ddfa1f50e56b69ce43c

[{'created': '2017-10-30 23:00:34.000000000', 'message': 'Retrigger new traversals after resource cancellation

If we force-cancel a resource check operation (i.e. by killing the thread)
then there was a short window where another traversal could have started
and been waiting on the not-yet-cancelled resource. That traversal would
then hang forever, as there was nothing to retrigger it. This change
ensures we retrigger the latest traversal on the resource after
cancellation.

Change-Id: Iae27c9cc5c0895b52aef2f2c72686dc48ec5983c
Closes-Bug: #1727007

commit_message:
Retrigger new traversals after resource cancellation

If we force-cancel a resource check operation (i.e. by killing the thread)
then there was a short window where another traversal could have started
and been waiting on the not-yet-cancelled resource. That traversal would
then hang forever, as there was nothing to retrigger it. This change
ensures we retrigger the latest traversal on the resource after
cancellation.

Change-Id: Iae27c9cc5c0895b52aef2f2c72686dc48ec5983c
Closes-Bug: #1727007

commit_message:
Modify memory swap metric type

The metric type of memory.swap.in and memory.swap.out shoule be
Cumulative, while the default is Gauge, so fix it.

Change-Id: I4da715027b3dabb1ceed4640773b1ad64aa50e9c

subject: Rely on container setup for haproxy's certificate user and group
messages: [{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-02 06:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-02 08:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from local-ca-haproxy to undercloud-containers-tls'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 06:32:44.000000000', 'message': "Rely on container setup for haproxy's certificate user and group

If we're on a containerized environment it might be that we don't have
the haproxy user and group (the containerized undercloud). So this sets
it up the owner as root and relies on the containerized setup to fix the
permissions instead. This way, we won't need to have the haproxy package
installed in the host.

Change-Id: If9a86e1e6b450fa4335e8c60aca512d7f4ca5894
"}]
commit_message:
Rely on container setup for haproxy's certificate user and group

If we're on a containerized environment it might be that we don't have
the haproxy user and group (the containerized undercloud). So this sets
it up the owner as root and relies on the containerized setup to fix the
permissions instead. This way, we won't need to have the haproxy package
installed in the host.

Change-Id: If9a86e1e6b450fa4335e8c60aca512d7f4ca5894

(1 comment)

lgtm jaosorior but i really don't know much about certmonger, but +2 as the change is simple and does what the commit says :) feel free to +A when ready"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2017-11-06 07:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-06 07:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right, so, we were only using FreeIPA as the CA, and that will still be true for the overcloud. However, for the containerized undercloud case, using the local CA is just fine. We started to test that out recently and stumbled upon this. So it's a fix for that use-case."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-06 07:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
certmonger/HAProxy: don't use principal if CA is local

using a service principal with the local CA fails with certmonger.

Change-Id: I25c7492a2982882f5ae9ac03af79b04e96fc7c31

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-04 05:23:26.000000000', 'message': "Certmonger: Only notify haproxy class if it's defined

The haproxy certmonger resource (which requests the HAProxy certs)
expected the haproxy puppet manifests to run alongside if we're using a
local CA. This is no longer the case in containerized environments, e.g.
the containerized undercloud. This makes that optional.

Change-Id: I2764ca1674dcd5ecd7886233bb5e9795ee697be3
(cherry picked from commit abd7a9486d8fb5cad7f6f0b48a466597f1d1bf71)
"}]
commit_message:
Certmonger: Only notify haproxy class if it's defined

The haproxy certmonger resource (which requests the HAProxy certs)
expected the haproxy puppet manifests to run alongside if we're using a
local CA. This is no longer the case in containerized environments, e.g.
the containerized undercloud. This makes that optional.

Change-Id: I2764ca1674dcd5ecd7886233bb5e9795ee697be3
(cherry picked from commit abd7a9486d8fb5cad7f6f0b48a466597f1d1bf71)

commit_message:
Ensure listing projects always returns tags

This just adds a test to make sure we always return the tags
attribute when listing projects. This was brought up in a tempest
review:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/485344/7

This commit just adds the test coverage.

Change-Id: I4cc8a150d4b0823755804937e50220dfcfb2a750

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex & assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I167d2125f72e069fef2434c21159ab15e9eb135e

When we notice that an instance was deleted after scheduling, we punt on
instance creation. When that happens, the scheduler will have created
allocations already so we need to delete those to avoid leaking resources.

'}]
commit_message:
Clean up allocations if instance deleted during build

When we notice that an instance was deleted after scheduling, we punt on
instance creation. When that happens, the scheduler will have created
allocations already so we need to delete those to avoid leaking resources.

Related-Bug: #1679750
Change-Id: I54806fe43257528fbec7d44c841ee4abb14c9dff
(cherry picked from commit 57a3af6921dea72b3b2972f66e089578331dbb63)

commit_message:
tempest: remove call to set_network_resources()

Since the merge of the stable interface for Tempest network_resources
[0], a call within the Manila scenario tests was causing failures
around the ordering of method calls in the set up of the test class.
This patch removes the call as currently it doesn't do anything and
will fix our scenario tests.

[0] - I4eab8f2a722b47edc20e4aab0ef453bec16842f3

Change-Id: Ia9226329035508c37ca499e6efbd2382502eb141
Closes-Bug: #1717562
(cherry picked from commit c26bd6b10c608029a505d3473b0bf61e178deee7)
(cherry picked from commit 699f0a7d2699d93b2177b163d2d614115b055407)

commit_message:
Remove legacy dsvm jobs from openstacksdk

They're broken anyway, but instead of fixing them in ozj, we'll just fix
them in the python-openstacksdk repo.

Change-Id: I2c7f6a0cb7f1acd38556a37c866bd35ea3369600

commit_message:
add a fullstack test for BGPVPN router fallback

Add a test checking that routing traffic via
a Neutron router coexists with having the network
or the router associated to a BGPVPN.

Change-Id: I91d164359b47c168addaa8da1c75efa31430d158
Depends-On: Ie953e60fff83e89fd19fabe85d2b4376e36031f0

commit_message:
Revert "Add .stestr.conf configuration"

Test to see if stestr is the cause of our py35 failures.

This reverts commit 203251d7ddd434660abefcc733e9518e367a7c98.

Change-Id: If5453bdbad24d0e408996993a2181849011c34a0

commit_message:
Port pci request from nova to zun

Change-Id: Iae65d7278e7f2f7c484a906f0101f1fbf0fdfd48
Depends-On: Ie9f278afb1af68379f8f641eba2e97dd582697cc
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-pcipassthroughfilter

subject: port pci tracker from nova to zun

commit_message:
Add make_pickleable_without_end_msg.

since vitrage support the creation of new drivers,
make_pickleable function can be used for various drivers,
including drivers which outside of openstack vitrage.
In order to enable drivers to use make_pickleable func
without adding end_message (use case example: pagination
purposes) the function make_pickleable_without_end_msg
is added.

Change-Id: I21750909975be9f2743db0306f56f6e1daf0d530

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 18:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I5bef8ab7f497803125a3c9d1659bea2747913e59
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c
'}]
commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I5bef8ab7f497803125a3c9d1659bea2747913e59
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

subject: Optimize the link address
messages:
[{'account_id': 23958, 'date': '2017-11-06 07:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-11-06 09:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

XieYingYun,

I'll have to repeat the comment I made at I8c774fc909b3fddd6130f19ff65a21ff38795728
The change you specifically made with this patch set is okay.
Nevertheless, I have to vote against it for the following reasons:
1. Having numerous patches that only change some URLs in the code base just creates an unneeded load on the OpenStack CI infra.
2. A single patch per URL creates unneeded noise for reviewers, in this case, you changed more than one, but not all. Again, this is counterproductive.

I'll have to ask you to address *all* the URLs that need an 'HTTP --> HTTPS' enhancement in this codebase, in a single patch. For the aforementioned reasons.

btw, a simple: git grep "http://" would give you the list, but note
that some URLs do need to stay as HTTP.

Thank you for understanding.'}, {'account_id': 23958, 'date': '2017-11-07 01:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 07:59:53.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the link address

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information
Change-Id: Ia441981e0f0236e68b139726818a10fd927700ef
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize the link address

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety without containing our
account/password information
Change-Id: Ia441981e0f0236e68b139726818a10fd927700ef

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: I073b5aff3c85851534d59cbc8c55baa520209f5f
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 07:59:04.000000000', 'message': "Avoid deleting allocations for instances being built

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations() assumes that
InstanceNotFound means that an instance was deleted. That's not quite accurate,
as we would also see that in the window between creating allocations and actually
creating the instance in the cell database. So, the code now will kill
allocations for those instances before they are created.

This change makes us look up the instance with read_deleted=yes, and if we find
it with deleted=True, then we do the allocation removal. This does mean that
someone running a full DB archive at the instant an instance is deleted in some
way that didn't result in allocation removal as well could leak those. However,
we can log that (unlikely) situation.

Closes-Bug: #1729371

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/resource_tracker.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts were due to not having change
1ff1310683c647517aa825059e4e6ad706e3da19 in Pike.

Change-Id: I4482ac2ecf8e07c197fd24c520b7f11fd5a10945
(cherry picked from commit d176175db456e4a312eed37ed4f5adcc06292fd5)
"}, {'created': '2017-11-06 12:06:56.000000000', 'message': "Avoid deleting allocations for instances being built

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations() assumes that
InstanceNotFound means that an instance was deleted. That's not quite accurate,
as we would also see that in the window between creating allocations and actually
creating the instance in the cell database. So, the code now will kill
allocations for those instances before they are created.

This change makes us look up the instance with read_deleted=yes, and if we find
it with deleted=True, then we do the allocation removal. This does mean that
someone running a full DB archive at the instant an instance is deleted in some
way that didn't result in allocation removal as well could leak those. However,
we can log that (unlikely) situation.

Closes-Bug: #1729371

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/resource_tracker.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts were due to not having change
1ff1310683c647517aa825059e4e6ad706e3da19 or change
e3b7f43e3ae9689967d2ecd1cd7974d829c78c85 in Pike.

Change-Id: I4482ac2ecf8e07c197fd24c520b7f11fd5a10945
(cherry picked from commit d176175db456e4a312eed37ed4f5adcc06292fd5)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid deleting allocations for instances being built

The resource tracker's _remove_deleted_instances_allocations() assumes that
InstanceNotFound means that an instance was deleted. That's not quite accurate,
as we would also see that in the window between creating allocations and actually
creating the instance in the cell database. So, the code now will kill
allocations for those instances before they are created.

This change makes us look up the instance with read_deleted=yes, and if we find
it with deleted=True, then we do the allocation removal. This does mean that
someone running a full DB archive at the instant an instance is deleted in some
way that didn't result in allocation removal as well could leak those. However,
we can log that (unlikely) situation.

Closes-Bug: #1729371

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/resource_tracker.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts were due to not having change
1ff1310683c647517aa825059e4e6ad706e3da19 or change
e3b7f43e3ae9689967d2ecd1cd7974d829c78c85 in Pike.

Change-Id: I4482ac2ecf8e07c197fd24c520b7f11fd5a10945
(cherry picked from commit d176175db456e4a312eed37ed4f5adcc06292fd5)

subject: ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 01:10:45.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb

e.g.OVS agent will be arised exception when deleting multiple vms in bulk.
Nova will delete tap by libvirt when removed vms at first.Then, ovs agent
check ovs_port by "self.get_ovs_port" , and the exception will be raised.
The patch catches exception caused by inconsistency coming from ovsdb.

Change-Id: I4cfa478f3393cf3734653995e00a1aa3f1afd6ad
Closes-Bug: #1729213
'}]
commit_message:
ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb

e.g.OVS agent will be arised exception when deleting multiple vms in bulk.
Nova will delete tap by libvirt when removed vms at first.Then, ovs agent
check ovs_port by "self.get_ovs_port" , and the exception will be raised.
The patch catches exception caused by inconsistency coming from ovsdb.

Change-Id: I4cfa478f3393cf3734653995e00a1aa3f1afd6ad

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: If8ce35a5c1a93e86308507076f975df5a8b0720e

commit_message:
Return availability_zone with the amphora record

This will enable a number of possible features that need to select
amphorae based on their availability_zone.
This is an alternate approach to storing the AZ directly in the DB.

Change-Id: I0c404f62f52314599c28c3d302a1a05dbfde9dc3
Story: 2001221
Task: 5732

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-06 18:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-06 18:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-06 21:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-11-07 00:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 18:20:39.000000000', 'message': 'Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Id60045b0b1324967859ee5df7078648e20f756bb
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c
'}, {'created': '2017-11-06 18:34:03.000000000', 'message': 'Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Id60045b0b1324967859ee5df7078648e20f756bb
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Handle stopping the health manager and ejecting out of current health failovers

Also handles the `failover_amphora` not working out or being
cancelled correctly and logging the statistics of those occurences
instead of incorrectly assuming everything always works out.

Depends-On: I3d86482a2999197a60a81d42afc5ef7a6e71e313

Change-Id: I240c328bb9d0902cb2a89a2808519264764aa6b0

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Change-Id: Idee22fe43691622f0c883a4f3197bfb25ca70d58
Depends-On: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

messages: [{'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2017-11-07 00:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-07 00:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 00:06:45.000000000', 'message': 'Release os-brick 2.0.0

This release includes a number of changes
to os-brick.  There are bugfixes as well as
improvements to multi-path support and a change
to avoid possible race conditions.

The release includes removal of legacy connector
constants that had been kept for backwards
compatibility.  As a result I am considering this
a backward incompatible change and bumping the
major version.

Change-Id: Ia852f69f1a2b9cdee02cad7ab9523ab959d71115
'}]
commit_message:
Release os-brick 2.0.0

This release includes a number of changes
to os-brick.  There are bugfixes as well as
improvements to multi-path support and a change
to avoid possible race conditions.

The release includes removal of legacy connector
constants that had been kept for backwards
compatibility.  As a result I am considering this
a backward incompatible change and bumping the
major version.

Change-Id: Ia852f69f1a2b9cdee02cad7ab9523ab959d71115

used, which is a wildcard that represents all projects.

commit_message:
Network: Add supports rbac target-all-projects

Add a boolean option "target-all-projects",
which allows creating rbac policy for all projects.

Change-Id: Ie3af83a1bba7dd66e83b0595bb276bf8fd105831
Closes-Bug: #1728525
Closes-Bug: #1704834

commit_message:
Pass requested_destination in filter_properties

When we added the requested_destination field for the RequestSpec object
in Newton, we forgot to pass it to the legacy dictionary when wanting to
use scheduler methods not yet supporting the NovaObject.
As a consequence, when we were transforming the RequestSpec object into a
tuple of (request_spec, filter_props) dicts and then rehydrating a new
RequestSpec object using those dicts, the newly created object was not
keeping that requested_destination field from the original.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflict is due to d288132dca7cc76dfc6679eda17bb8fcc62577de
not being in Ocata, but it's not needed either.

Change-Id: Iba0b88172e9a3bfd4f216dd364d70f7e01c60ee2
Closes-Bug: #1702454
(cherry picked from commit 69bef428bd555bb31f43db6ca9c21db8aeb9007e)
(cherry picked from commit bceb176fb00104fb0e39d6f1f3183f616c2b90f7)

commit_message:
Pass requested_destination in filter_properties

When we added the requested_destination field for the RequestSpec object
in Newton, we forgot to pass it to the legacy dictionary when wanting to
use scheduler methods not yet supporting the NovaObject.
As a consequence, when we were transforming the RequestSpec object into a
tuple of (request_spec, filter_props) dicts and then rehydrating a new
RequestSpec object using those dicts, the newly created object was not
keeping that requested_destination field from the original.

Change-Id: Iba0b88172e9a3bfd4f216dd364d70f7e01c60ee2
Closes-Bug: #1702454
(cherry picked from commit 69bef428bd555bb31f43db6ca9c21db8aeb9007e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-03 18:08:44.000000000', 'message': 'Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

commit_message:
Used cached git sources and enable depends-on

Many, many patches have gone into the master branch to
enable the use of depends-on for role tests and to make
use of the git clones put into place by zuul. This patch
ensures that this functionality is now available for this
branch too.

The primary benefit for doing this would be to make use
of the cached git clones provided by zuul to improve test
reliability.

The secondary benefit would be to have the ability to
use depends-on to test patches together.

However, this will come at the cost of requiring a tox
configuration change, and the implementation of the
tests/tests-repo-clone.sh and run_tests.sh scripts
across all repositories.

Required repositories which do not have a newton branch
are removed from the job definition.

Change-Id: Ia806f19e00703c53f03a2420dbac1da4ba68db6c

commit_message:
Functional regression test for evacuate with a target

In I6ddcaaca37fc5387c2d2e9f51c67ea9e85acb5c5 we forgot to update the
legacy filter properties dictionary so the requested target wasn't
passed to the scheduler when evacuating.
Adding a functional test for verifying the behaviour.

NOTE(sbauza): The issue has been incendentally fixed in Pike by
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2 so the regression test just
verifies that the expected behaviour works.
The Newton and Ocata backports will be slightly different from that one as we
need to verify that host3 will be preferred eventually over host2.

Related-Bug: #1702454

commit_message:
Functional regression test for evacuate with a target

In I6ddcaaca37fc5387c2d2e9f51c67ea9e85acb5c5 we forgot to update the
legacy filter properties dictionary so the requested target wasn't
passed to the scheduler when evacuating.
Adding a functional test for verifying the behaviour.

NOTE(sbauza): The issue has been incendentally fixed in Pike by
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2 so the regression test just
verifies that the expected behaviour works.
That specific backport is consequently different from the master change
as the final target is different from the one we expected.

Related-Bug: #1702454

In contributor policies bugs doc there are links to

This commit updates links to those launchpad pages that
it will display bugs for currently supported releases.

'}, {'created': '2017-11-06 18:36:37.000000000', 'message': "Update section with links to backport/RC potential bugs

commit_message:
Update section with links to backport/RC potential bugs

In this section there were only links to 3 stale branches.
Now it describes how link to Launchpad's page with
links to current stable branches can be build.

Change-Id: I721dfbb7e907eb1f4bac0fdb4f6fe35dc447dee1

commit_message:
Add .stestr.conf configuration

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: If553a64f5dded2d47025c947a91f13091f3f5d14

commit_message:
Add export of cluster templates to UI

Partially-Implements: bp portable-node-group-and-cluster-templates

Depends-On: I027169ace70929318990a4225d456bf1cf8a83b2

This chande adds an option to GUI to enable user export a cluster template

Change-Id: If1c1b055c3f03b656853db1b35c42a422b08de7f

commit_message:
Kolla Documentation Restructuring

At PTG in Denver, we decided to follow the doc team restructuring format
guidelines for the Kolla documentation full revamp. This patchset is the
initial restructuring of the existing doc files that we will use to build on.

See discussion notes in the PTG etherpad:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kolla-doc-restructure

Partially Implements: blueprint queens-doc-restructure

Change-Id: Ibb19bc2c79a25ab8d343581f6ed1783864eaf389

> how does one test this?

I ran following command to test: python2/3 setup.py build_sphinx'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2017-06-15 19:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There is actually a bigger problem than the one we are trying to solve. The html_last_updated_fmt is from the repo being updated and not actually any api. We should be able to filter on commits that only effect api-ref changes but no one is really doing that as you can see from the neutron example is referencing a commit that has a release note.. not an api change.

The problem being solved here is the b in front of the python3 output. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15374211/why-does-popen-communicate-return-bhi-n-instead-of-hi

Why is one better than the other? It makes it more ready to print. I'm not sure how the docs handle this but you can see it is printing the correct value, https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/database/ "updated: 'Thu Jun 15 07:17:50 2017, commit 2983962'"

so there is nothing to fix... my guess is that the build for docs is still using python2.

Check out neutron's api-ref, https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/ you will see it is different. "updated: 'Tue Jun 6 22:11:05 2017, commit 1401560'"


Here's what I did to test, (the Oct date is from my improve ports validation patch)

Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 19 2016, 06:48:10) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import subprocess
>>> git_cmd = ["git", "log", "--pretty=format:'%ad, commit %h'", "--date=local",
...            "-n1"]
>>> subprocess.Popen(
...         git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0]
"'Mon Oct 31 13:19:47 2016, commit 91d443e'"
>>> subprocess.check_output(git_cmd).decode('utf-8')
u"'Mon Oct 31 13:19:47 2016, commit 91d443e'"


Python 3.5.2 (default, Nov 17 2016, 17:05:23) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import subprocess
>>> git_cmd = ["git", "log", "--pretty=format:'%ad, commit %h'", "--date=local",
...            "-n1"]
>>> subprocess.Popen(
...         git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0]
b"'Mon Oct 31 13:19:47 2016, commit 91d443e'"
>>> subprocess.check_output(git_cmd).decode('utf-8')
"'Mon Oct 31 13:19:47 2016, commit 91d443e'"

Also Hieu, that is not how to test it.. show me your output from your python3 client after running "python3 setup.py build_sphinx"'}, {'account_id': 13562, 'date': '2017-11-06 19:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I9e86ec020c0ad56b9b5c8e47a27b9667e565f036
Closes-Bug: #1693670

This LGTM, though the choice of "func" (now "functional") in dib-utils was I think close to random.

So only question is if there is a better moniker for these, but really it's just tox invoking a shell script for dib-utils so i can't think of anything else.  standardising on at least one seems like a good idea'}]

commit_message:
Create openstack-tox-functional

A couple of projects run a custom tox-functional job, create a single
job for them.

Needed-By: I9d0c7b53cacf685f6a6fe593c457eb9a1b3570bc
Change-Id: Ibebf9d0eeccabaefa2777a43592a72d19d064b6b

commit_message:
Add option to use JSON formatter

This adds the use_json option, which will use the JSON formatter
instead of the deafult ContextFormatter if set.

Closes-Bug: #1729331

Since openvswitch-2.8, some selinux policies installed
with openstack-selinux are required for openvswitch
services to start properly.

Funtion ovs_vxlan_bridge is used in multinode environments
to instal ovs in subnodes, so this patch is installing
openstack-selinux when installing openvswitch. Note that
selinux is not mandatory in ovs for non-openstack environments
so it can't be added as dependency in RPM.

Change-Id: Ia188c24a92253d54bdd536ec9a720adb9959d78f
"}]
commit_message:
Install openstack-selinux with openvswitch

Since openvswitch-2.8, some selinux policies installed
with openstack-selinux are required for openvswitch
services to start properly.

Funtion ovs_vxlan_bridge is used in multinode environments
to instal ovs in subnodes, so this patch is installing
openstack-selinux when installing openvswitch. Note that
selinux is not mandatory in ovs for non-openstack environments
so it can't be added as dependency in RPM.

Change-Id: Ia188c24a92253d54bdd536ec9a720adb9959d78f

commit_message:
PermitRootLogin for hosts group

Allow login as root user to hosts.
We currently use root user for all our tasks, this causes the integrated
build to fail, and would cause all deploys to fail too, since ansible
can't log into the hosts as the root user.

Change-Id: I8d34cef23b81e5474b8f2c0e7b7d8bbac3a5dc00

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-08 06:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I644c8af33f8c14b1e72ef51026ded87144550d9c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I644c8af33f8c14b1e72ef51026ded87144550d9c

Add OS::Neutron::RBACPolicy resource

This change added OS::Neutron::RBACPolicy to heat.

Depends-on: I9e38bbfb7fceee3e1fff5eb3db40a6659d01b383

Blueprint: support-rbac-for-networks

subject: Remove defaults from namespace and prefix for container images
messages: [{'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.openstack.org/#/c/516139/2 is better implementation of same behavior'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 20:06:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove defaults from namespace and prefix for container images

tripleo-common provides the defaults now, so let the defaults
be specified in one place instead of multiple different locations

Change-Id: I2fa498cc2273df2783de378e67a7c39c80d0678e
Resolves: #1730487
'}]
commit_message:
Remove defaults from namespace and prefix for container images

tripleo-common provides the defaults now, so let the defaults
be specified in one place instead of multiple different locations

Change-Id: I2fa498cc2273df2783de378e67a7c39c80d0678e
Resolves: #1730487

Reading the doc, it looks like it won't work, not just because of the correction you propose."}, {'account_id': 23326, 'date': '2017-01-03 01:54:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> have you attempted to verify that this configuration works?
 > 
 > Reading the doc, it looks like it won't work, not just because of
 > the correction you propose.

As I known, it will influce the taskmanager service to get the instance ip, such as when you create a mongodb cluster. I have verified it in Mitaka branch, the master branch not yet."}, {'account_id': 23326, 'date': '2017-01-03 02:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> This needs further changing for Ocata: There is no more
 > nova-network support in Ocata.

You are right!

In fact, I don't recommend to config it in the install guide for it's not so critical. Keep its default value and just let the ones to do it using their real network label or ".*", no matter nova-network or neutron-network. It seems that the trove.conf file does like this.'}, {'account_id': 23326, 'date': '2017-01-03 02:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-03 05:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
[install-guide] Make changes in editing trove-taskmanager.conf

URL: http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/database/draft/install-rdo.html

Make changes in the 5th step of "Install and configure components", for reasons that:

1.According to the context, there is a spelling error: "And finally, if using Nova Network..."
shoud be "And finally, if using Neutron Network...". But I removed the related for reson 2.

2.I don't think it's necessary to config "network_label_regex" in the install guide for it's
not so critical. Just keep its default value and let the ones to do it using their real network
label or ".*". It seems that trove.conf does like this. And,there is no more nova-network support
in Ocata.

3.I remove the sentence "Include ConfigDrive settings..." for it's repeated with the configration
description "# Inject configuration into guest via ConfigDrive".

Change-Id: Id7c7b5d2986a38aadf03e1398ac32b068a28f48d
Closes-Bug: #1653242
